characters: A NEW SONG COMES OVER THE LOUDSPEAKERS
THE TREES SEEM TO BE FLOATING
SHRIEK AS HE WRENCHES THEM FROM THE COILED STRINGS...
A CRAZED LOOK IN HIS EYES
A CASSETTE IS PUSHED INTO A CAR STEREO
A CABLE IS PLUGGED INTO AN ELECTRIC GUITAR
THEY PASS BY A LINE OF CARS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE’RE CLOSE ON THE FACE OF JAMES BRENNAN, 22. He’s gazing at someone off-screen, eye filled with longing. THERE’S NO SOUND. Behind him, OUT OF FOCUS, college kids a rollicking party...

dialogues.speaker: THE SOUND FADES IN SLOWLY
dialogues.text: Shouted, drunken conversation competes with a stereo blas “Bastards of Young” by The Replacements. A couple wear graduation mortarboards.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ON
dialogues.text: a pretty young woman, ARLENE. She’s avoiding James’s gaze They’re in a lived-in off-campus house. They hold cocktai in plastic cups. He leans in close.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hey, you want to get out of here-

dialogues.speaker: ARLENE
dialogues.text: (hasn’t heard him) What a rager, huh?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah. (beat) Isn’t it weird? That this all...this happened right at the end of the semester? You and...me. She finally looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And we'll both be in Manhattan come September. (beat) I’m really...fond of you.

dialogues.speaker: ARLENE
dialogues.text: You’re sweet. (beat, thinking) James.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ARLENE
dialogues.text: I don’t think I can see you anymore.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 2. 1

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (stunned) You don’t...? What do you...?

dialogues.speaker: ARLENE
dialogues.text: We’re graduating...it’s... She sighs heavily and looks away. James watches her, wait for more of an explanation. Instead:

dialogues.speaker: ARLENE
dialogues.text: (muttering) sorry. She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James stands with two friends, ERIC (unkempt and shaggy- haired, yet radiates a casual air of privilege) and BRAD, who’s mixing a drink from the dregs of whatever liquor bottles he can find.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Women are mercurial, man.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: You did just start dating last week.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I know, but...I thought that she got me...

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: You didn’t tell her about the ‘scarlet V'?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: That has nothing...

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: You did. Brennan, you promised me!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Look, I don’t lie to people I care about.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: But you could've just left it out of the narrative! You don’t want ‘virgin’ to be your signifier!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Jesus, he takes one semiotics class... Brad hands the ‘cocktail’ to James.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 3.

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Drink up.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Listen. You need to bed down the next plain-looking, insecure depressive who throws herself at you and get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I’ve had ample opportunities to get laid, if I just wanted to get it over with-

dialogues.speaker: BRAD
dialogues.text: Or a hooker. In New York, I hear the Asian ones are the best value.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Right, that was in Consumer Reports? Jesus. I know most people have low standards, but I’m different.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: We’ll find you a girl. When we’re on the Continent. An OBNOXIOUS CLASSMATE joins their group, picking up all liquor bottles, looking for one that’s not empty.

dialogues.speaker: OBNOXIOUS CLASSMATE
dialogues.text: So you guys are going to Europe? Even you, Brennan?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah. My graduation present.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Forget about Arlene.

dialogues.speaker: OBNOXIOUS CLASSMATE
dialogues.text: She dumped you? Ouch. Another one.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You've checked the Beefeater three times, Steve. All the bottles are empty.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: James, focus on the trip. It’s going to be a transformative experience. Transformative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party has entered another phase. Brad sits in a circl of pot-smokers, passing around a pipe. Eric is making out with a girl. James stands alone, in a corner.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 4. 3

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He sees Arlene across the room, holding court with her friends. She’s clearly talking about him. Humiliated, he skulks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A newish, 80s-model sky blue Plymouth Reliant rolls down highway, James’s bicycle strapped to the roof. James is slumped against the window, sharing the back seat with so duffel bags and crates of records.

dialogues.speaker: WE PASS BY
dialogues.text: strip malls and chain stores... a high school, looking a little worse for the wear... suburban homes, varying only slightly from one another...

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR APPROACHES
dialogues.text: a young man on a bicycle. The back of his orange t-shirt reads:

dialogues.speaker: ADVENTURELAND
dialogues.text: As the car passes, we see the biker, a wiry, goofy-lookin year-old. His name is TOMMY FRIGO. Frigo recognizes James. He grins and gives him the finger

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER, 1987
dialogues.text: MUSIC STARTS: “EVERYBODY KNOWS THIS NOWHERE” by NEIL YOUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The EQ on the Neil Young song changes -- IT’S PLAYING ON JAMES’S BOOMBOX. He sits in his bed, writing on a legal p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocktail hour in the Brennan household. COUNT BASIE swing on the stereo, as James’s father (MR. BRENNAN) is finishi off a frozen daiquiri, preparing another. MRS. BRENNAN si white wine, while reading a paperback copy of “Iacocca: A Autobiography”. James enters, clutching the legal pad, looking determined

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Okay, so I need to talk to you guys about-  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 5.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: (putting down her book) Now what do you want for dinner? I can make a roast, burgers, minute steaks?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Wow. I, uh-

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: (crossing to the fridge) ...or leftover lamb stew.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Any of that sounds-—

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: And I even got that frozen manicotti, the kind you like.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: He loves that.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Sure. Let’s have that. So...the trip is going to cost a tiny bit more than we discussed.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: What are we talking about?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Um, my Europe trip? So my original estimate for the whole trip was 1,568 dollars. But I’ve researched more youth hostels and the median cost is a bit higher than I thought, by seven dollars and sixty-eight cents, multiplied by forty-two days is $322.56. But the good news is I still qualify for a student eurail pass, which saves us $143.45. But I also think my emergency fund is unrealistic at $100, I should make it $150. So, with the 768 dollars I have from grandma’s trust fund, plus the 800 you guys are already giving me, I will need another 229 dollars and eleven cents. It makes the total for you guys 1,029 dollars and eleven cents.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: One-thousand and twenty-nine dollars.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: And eleven cents. James's parents exchange a look.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 6.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: James, your father has been transferred to a different department.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Really? That’s great-

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: It’s not a better department. We’1l be making less money. Considerably less.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Wh...what happened?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: It’s not a big deal, they just, they reorganized a bit. It’s temporary.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: We hope. I’m sorry, honey, I know we said we thought we could help with your trip. We can’t.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: But it’s my graduation present.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: I know, but we don’t have it. We can’t spare a penny for Europe. And we can’t spare a penny for grad school, either.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What? You were going to help me with rent?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: James, we cancelled our week in Montauk. We can barely make the house payments. We’re clipping coupons.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Sorry, kiddo.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What am I gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: If you decide you really want to go to graduate school, you'll commute from here.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: But...Eric and I are getting an apartment in Manhattan...  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 7.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: If you want to eventually move into the city, you better get a job.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: A summer job?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Better start looking. Most of the good ones are grabbed up. Here. Mrs. Brennan hands James the classified ads. James stares the paper as if there’s a dead fish in it. Mr. Brennan starts the blender -- but he hasn’t affixed the lid prope The blender sprays daiquiri all over a cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Whoa, Nelly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, dorky in a button-down shirt and knit tie, stands front of a RESTAURANT MANAGER, handing him documents.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I really haven’t had many jobs, per se... But here’s my academic record and my extracurricular activities. I wrote for the literary journal, ‘The Gordian Knot’. And in high school, I got a 750 on the math SATs, so I'd be good at tabulating checks-

dialogues.speaker: RESTAURANT MANAGER
dialogues.text: These are the only jobs you’ve had?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I also used to rake leaves for some neighbors, the Palmieri’s. I have their letter of recommendation-

dialogues.speaker: RESTAURANT MANAGER
dialogues.text: (brusquely) Fill this out. I’11 call you if anything comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is mowing his parents’ lawn, a look of self-pity on face.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: Tommy Frigo comes tearing down the street on his ten-spee He rolls up on the lawn, jumps off the bike and sprints a James, a crazed look in his eyes.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 8.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Nad attack! Frigo throws a punch at James’s groin. James manages to partially deflect the blow.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Frigo! Quit it! The two young men start swinging wildly at each other.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Watch out, the lawn mower! James turns for a second. Frigo wallops him directly in t privates. James falls to the lawn, moaning.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I’m going to fucking kill you, Frigo... Frigo hops back on his bike.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Ha-hah, Brennan! Don’t choke on your own goo!! Frigo pedals away, cackling maniacally. We see that he’s once again wearing his orange ‘Adventureland’ shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Eric stroll down the sidewalk. Eric wears his “bohemian uniform”: painter’s pants, tie-dyed shirt, shel necklace and a kerchief over his head. James glances arou anxiously as Eric brazenly smokes a joint.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Home all summer. On Long Island. Fuckin’ harsh.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It’s a nightmare. I mean, I'ma romantic! I actually read poetry for pleasure. Out where I grew up, if I tell someone that, they’1ll beat me to death with a table leg.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: You still thinking about graduate school?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 9.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Total mistake. What do you need another degree for? Did Henry Miller need a degree? Or Samuel Beckett?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Actually, Beckett went to Trinity College and after that he was an assistant for James Joyce. Which is a story I always wanted to turn into a two-character play-

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Yeah, shut up, my point is -- you don’t come from money. Graduate school’s gonna require massive loans. Three more years of school, then, what, a decade or two of paying them off? Why not blow your brains out now?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: But if something’s worth doing...

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Take some time to picture the narrative of your life. Needing it or wanting money is the fundamental trap of humankind. (putting a hand on James's shoulder) Look, I want you to know you'll be with me in spirit this summer. Take this... From a coat pocket, Eric produces a baggie that contains several thin, poorly-rolled joints.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: But, you know...I get a little crazy-

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Take it. James nervously jams the bag into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: You think you don’t like weed. You will.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (worried, won’t drop it) But how am I going to break into journalism if I don’t go to grad school?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Brennan, you’ll be with me! In a few short months we’ll be in New York City. We’1ll be living the adventure together!  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 10. 10 11 12 13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Brennan reads a library copy of a biography of Pope Paul II. James sits across from her, hunched over the classifieds section, grunting as he reads.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What can I get?! I’m not even qualified for manual labor. (reading down column) carpenter...dishwasher...mechanic... septic waste removal -- they won’t even hire me. The only place I know I can get a job is where Frigo’s working.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Adventureland? You can do better. You have to try harder.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I’m ‘O' for twenty-two. I majored in comparative literature and Renaissance studies. Unless someone needs help restoring a fresco, I’m screwed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK WITH James on his bicycle, pedaling along with morn traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James rolls into a large parking lot, passing under an ar sign that reads “ADVENTURELAND”. A gangly young man (RICH approaches him. He uses a yellow plastic wiffle ball bat direct traffic.

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: Right here, sir! Right here! Rich waves James toward a bicycle rack. Rich’s shirt read “Parking Captain”.

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: Have a funtastic day and come again!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Uh, okay. James, making eye contact, realizes that Rich is mentally challenged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James stands with PAULETTE, 40s. Her badge reads “MANAGER  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 11.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I don’t have much work experience, per se- Paulette’s walkie-talkie emits a LOUD BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: (into walkie) G’head.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE OVER WALKIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Li’l Red’s down again.

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: Okay, there in a sec. (calling out) Bobby! Get over here! BOBBY, 40, moustache, bad tinted glasses, crosses over fr the snack bar counter. His badge: “JR. MANAGER”.

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: This kid’s applying for a games job.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Actually, I'd rather work rides if that’s-

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: Nah, you're a games type. Here’s the number one rule. No freebies. No free turns to your friends, no free upgrades, no free stuffed animals. Anyone wins a giant-ass pandas, you’re fired. Got it? Paulette hands Bobby some forms and exits.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Here, have a seat. They sit in a booth.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: So what positions are presently open-

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Games. You're hired. Fill this out. Bobby slides a start form across the table. As James star to fill it out, Bobby stares out the window, checking out some teenage girls in short shorts and tube tops. He sigh At a nearby booth, a kid starts puking on the table.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 12.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Geez. Kid, can’t you do that outside? (yelling) Doreen! We got a puker! 14 INT. “GAMES PALACE” ARCADE, ADVENTURELAND - DAY 14 We are greeted by a cacophony of pinball, skee ball, air hockey, Whac-a-Mole, Ms. Pac Man, Dig Dug, Zaxxon, etc. James now wears a light blue t-shirt -- stacked in descen size, it reads: “Games, Games, Games, Games”. He stands with JOEL SCHIFFMAN, 22, who has glasses, curly reddish-b hair and some scraggly chin growth.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s get this over with- Joel notices a bratty KID with a runny nose who’s slammin his fists down on the buttons of an old-fashioned “Bimbo Dancing Clown” machine.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Hey, retard. Stop pounding on Bimbo.

dialogues.speaker: RUNNY-NOSE KID
dialogues.text: This game sucks. It doesn’t do nothin’.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: It kicks your ass if you don’t get the fuck away from it. The kid scurries away. Joel smiles. The kid runs up to hi burly, mean-looking father.

dialogues.speaker: RUNNY-NOSE KID
dialogues.text: Dad! (pointing at Joel) He said the f-word at me!

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Fuuuck. Let’s go. Joel hustles James out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel is marching James up the midway. We get our first go look at “Adventureland” -- it’s a ramshackle place, a lot closer to Coney Island than to Disney World. “Rock Me Amadeus” by Falco echoes across the park (top fo radio plays loudly all day long, every day).

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: F.Y.I., Paulette and Bobby are married, so watch what you say.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JOEL (cont'd) And never walk directly below the “Sky Chopper”. The little animals are always spewing and dropping boogers on your head.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Brennan, you loser! James looks toward the “Antique Cars” ride and sees Frigo hanging out the side of a buggy car, driving it for two s children.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Ha-hahhhh! They put you on games, you pussy loser! Brennan’s a pussy! The children shriek as Frigo rear-ends another buggy car.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: You know that demented person?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah. He used to be my best friend. Then I turned four. 16 EXT. “LAUGHING CLOWN” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - LATER 16 Joel and James are at the ubiquitous carnival game wherei contestants squirt water into a plastic clown-head’s mout inflating a balloon until it pops.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: The trick here: you’ve got a better chance of winning if you pick a clown with a new balloon. The old balloons have already been stretched out. Less likely to pop. You can share this info with cute girls at your discretion.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: No sweat, new guy. 17 EXT. “HATS OFF TO LARRY” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - LATER This booth features an elaborate painted street scene. Revolving through doorways are creepy fiberglass dummies wearing black felt hats. Joel hits a button and the dummi stop moving.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: The object is to try and knock the hat off the dummy with a softball. 13.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 14. 17 18 19

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Joel tugs on one of the hats. It doesn’t budge.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Except half the hats are glued on. EXT. “THE FLIGHING DUTCHMAN!” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - LATE Joel and James are approaching another game booth.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: This game is inexplicably called “The Flying Dutchman”. Even more inexplicable is how they decided to spell it. Morons. The sign reads: “THE FLIGHING DUTCHMAN!” They enter the game, which is a platform with forty or so large milk bottles. Very large stuffed panda bears are dangling over them.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: One dollar buys five rings. If the ring lands on one of the red bottles, they win one of these giant-ass pandas.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: That is a giant-ass panda.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: It’s the best prize in the park. And that’s because this game is unwinnable. Observe. I'’11 drop the ring from three inches away. Joel holds a plastic ring right above a bottle. He drops The ring bounces off.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Nobody ever wins?

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: If they do, it’s because you weren’t being vigilant and they reached over and placed the ring on the bottle. Someone wins a giant-ass panda bear on your watch? Go home, you’re fired. EXT. “FREE THROW” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - LATER 19 They stand at a booth with five basketball hoops.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: If you stand directly below a hoop you will see that it’s been hammered into an oval shape. But back here, the sucker can’t tell.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 15. 19 20

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: James passes a basketball through the narrow hoop.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It barely fits. That’s...so wrong.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: A criminal abuse of the laws of perspective.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Well, people are getting ripped off-

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, Trotsky, let’s get you a booth. (he walks away, James follows) So, your life must be utter shit or you wouldn’t be here.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah. I want to be in Manhattan. But to make enough to cover rent and actually save anything seems so hard.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Wait til your parents start charging you rent. My dad even makes me pay utilities. EXT. “THE FLIGHING DUTCHMAN!” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - DUSK It’s the hour when the park starts getting overrun with teenagers and young adults. Blaring from the many loudspeakers is “Something About You” by Level 42. James's booth is getting crowded. A hyperactive guy in a faded MOLLY HATCHET T-SHIRT is demanding his attention:

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY HATCHET T-SHIRT
dialogues.text: Yo! Guy! How many rings for a ticket?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Five per ticket.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY HATCHET T-SHIRT
dialogues.text: Give me five. How usually does someone win here?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Actually, I just started-

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY HATCHET T-SHIRT
dialogues.text: I heard that some big fat lady fell off the Paratrooper a couple of weeks ago.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 16.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Really? Was she okay?

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY HATCHET T-SHIRT
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Give me ten. No, give me fifteen. I heard she was a big, fat, really fat lady... James notices that the customer’s eyes are darting to something behind him. Just as James turns to look, he see DRUNK DAD (wearing a Scorpions concert tee) holding his s year-old child over the milk bottles. The boy places a ri on a red bottle and the man quickly pulls him back.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK DAD
dialogues.text: (slurring drunkenly) He won! Check it out! Look, my kid won! Check it out! Awright, Dom!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (lowering his voice) Sir, I saw you holding him over the bottles. That’s cheating.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK DAD
dialogues.text: What?! He won square-and-fair! Give him the prize!

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY HATCHET T-SHIRT
dialogues.text: I saw the kid throw it!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: C'mon, guys, give me a break-

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY HATCHET T-SHIRT
dialogues.text: (for passersby to hear) This faggot’s trying to cheat a kid! Give the kid his prize! James glances over to a fellow employee in the adjoining booth, a pint-size, funny-looking 15-year-old, MUNCH (his nickname, short for “Munchkin”). He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Guys, fellas, I could lose my job-

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK DAD
dialogues.text: (leaning close) Give my kid the fuckin’ panda. The dad shows James a hunting knife he’s concealing by hi hip. Suddenly, a young woman in a “GAMES” t-shirt, EM LEWIN, enters from the other side. She pulls down a panda and gi it to the man.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 17.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Here you go.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK DAD
dialogues.text: Yeah, thank you. That faggot was trying to rip off a kid. The drunk dad stumbles off with his son, joined by the Mo Hatchet t-shirt guy, who snickers. James turns to Em. She cute -- no makeup, dark hair, pale skin, intelligent eyes

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (anxious ) Am I gonna get in trouble? Nobody’s ever supposed to win a giant-ass panda?

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Is it worth getting knifed over? I’m Em.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hi. James.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. Sucks you’re gonna get fired your first day.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (panicky) No, shit, I need this job-

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Relax, man. I’m kidding. BEHIND THEM, Munch cups his hands over his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: Yo, Connell!

dialogues.speaker: STRIDING TOWARD CAMERA IS
dialogues.text: MIKE CONNELL. He’s in his 30s, wears an ankle-length blac coat. His attractive features are framed by sunglasses an mass of unkempt hair. He carries a guitar case that’s emblazoned with the logo for a metal band: ANIMUS.

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: (flashing the “devil sign”)

dialogues.speaker: ROCK OOOOONNN
dialogues.text: Em watches Connell as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Who's that?  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 18. 20 21 22 23 24 25

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: That’s Connell. One of the maintenance guys. As Connell continues through the park, employees hoot and rebel-yell to him.. INT. MANAGER’S OFFICE, ADVENTURELAND - NIGHT 21 James hands his ticket apron to Bobby. Frigo is punching out. A trashy-looking DRUNK WOMAN is slumped in a chair. Paulette talks into a loudspeaker microphone.

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: (reverberating across park) Ashley, your mother is looking for you. She’s waiting for you in the manager’s office, next to the snack bar.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK WOMAN
dialogues.text: Where is that little shit?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is riding his bicycle home. A Mercedes swerves clos as it passes, honking -- the occupants, rich teenagers, l at him. James scowls. Another car is rolling up beside him, a cinnamon-colored Pacer. Em is driving. They exchange a look... she drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glum James eats with his family.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Why don’t you call one of your old friends? Dave? Gerry?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: And tell them I work as a carny? No thank you. Mrs. Brennan looks at her husband. He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James once again pedaling his bike alongside heavy mornin traffic. And it’s raining. He looks miserable. EXT. “KENTUCKY DERBY” GAME, ADVENTURELAND - LATER 25 STILL A GRAY, RAINY DAY. To make matters worse, “Pac-Man Fever” by Buckner & Garcia plays over the PA.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 19. 25

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: James is manning the Kentucky Derby booth -- contestants each other by using a lever to flip a ball into a hole, w advances a mechanical horse.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (into a microphone, lackluster) Okay. And the race is on. He rings a bell and the contestants begin racing. He star absently off at a kid who is picking his nose and wiping snot on the booth wall. A bell goes off. JAMES (cont'd) And we, uh, have a winner. The blue horse. Yellow is second. Purple is third. Congratulations. As he gives a stuffed animal to the girl who won, James s Bobby walking quickly toward him, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: James! Come on! I told you! You need to make it exciting!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Maybe, um, I’m not the right guy to run this game?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No. You do the job or you lose the job. You already lost me one giant-ass panda. C'mon, haven’t you ever seen a horse race?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Harness racing or the normal kind?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Who cares?! Just make it fun! Jesus. James nods. He collects tickets for the next race.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (attempting some enthusiasm) Okay, ladies and gentleman, put down your mint juleps and welcome to the Kentucky Derby! The horses are at the starting gate! Are you ready?! The contestants stare at him with blank expressions.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Okay. And they’re off! He rings the bell.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 20. 25 26

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (building steam) And Red, uh, Red bolts out of the gate, taking an early lead! But look out! Here comes Green, issuing a challenge from the outside lane! Green runs well on a muddy track, folks, so today’s conditions give him a slight edge. And Yellow is dead last! What a disappointment after Yellow’s strong showing at Saratoga last spring. Wait a second! Out of nowhere, Orange has broken ahead of the pack! In the backstretch, it’s Orange and Green! Orange and Green! And Orange takes it by a nose! Green places and Red shows. Please come to the window to collect your winnings! Once more, the contestants stare at James with blank expressions.

dialogues.speaker: ADULT CONTESTANT
dialogues.text: What window?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Nothing. Forget it. Here you go. As James hands out a few crappy stuffed animals, he glanc across the midway, where Em is working in another booth. gives him a commiserative half-smile. EXT. “REMOTE CONTROL BOATS”, ADVENTURELAND - NEXT DAY 26 “These Dreams” by Heart plays on the loudspeaker AS WE CR DOWN TO James, on a bench, reading a Penguin paperback. H on a break. Behind him is a concrete pond where kids are operating radio-controlled miniature speedboats. PETE O'MALLEY (19, tall, athletic, freckled, red-haired I American) is walking by with a few buddies. They all wear “RIDES” t-shirts. Pete turns to James.

dialogues.speaker: PETE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, you're new, right?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah. Started a few days ago.

dialogues.speaker: PETE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: Cool. What are you reading?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) It’s a Henry Miller book... ‘Quiet Days In Clichy’.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 21. 26 27 28

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pete nods, interested -- which pleasantly surprises James

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: He was an American author who lived a long time in Paris. It’s a wonderful novella about the bohemian life in France in the thirties.

dialogues.speaker: PETE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Can I see?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Sure. Of course. Pete looks at the book for a moment, nodding...

dialogues.speaker: THEN
dialogues.text: he tosses it into the pond. His buddies double over in hysterics.

dialogues.speaker: PETE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: (grinning) Seeya, dork. The boys lope away. James, looking humiliated, watches hi floating book being attacked by remote-control boats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is prone on the couch, watching the classic prison movie “Cool Hand Luke” on TV. James nods in exaggerated empathy as Strother Martin breaks Paul Newman’s spirit...

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: EXT. “GOLD FISH BOWL” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - ANOTHER NIGH Over the park, Falco once again chants “Rock Me, Amadeus” James and Joel are working an unpopular booth. James is hunched over a legal pad and the New York Times classifie

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I am amazed at how tiny my paychecks are. I mean, I’ve been working doubles.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Well, we are doing the work of pathetic, lazy morons.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I figured out that I’1l probably need three to four hundred a month for my share of the apartment. If I can save up twelve hundred dollars this summer, that’s three or four months of rent.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 22. 28 29

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Sure. As long as you can eat for under thirty-seven cents a day. James, we’re both on the losing side of supply-side economics. My dad’s been laid off three times in the last couple of years. I got into Cornell, but the financial aid wasn’t enough. So it’s been state school for me. As they mull over their realities, a group of pretty teen girls walk by with their muscle-bound boyfriends.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: All these pretty girls. Going out with troglodytes. This is the last place on Earth anyone would find me desirable.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: You have a girlfriend at college?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I did. Then I didn’t. You?

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: The last girl I kissed was my tenth grade chem lab partner. She had braces. Fourteen stitches on my tongue. They stand for a moment, while we hear:

dialogues.speaker: FALCO SINGS, (OVER LOUDSPEAKER)
dialogues.text: Amadeus, Amadeus...AMADEUS! Oh oh oh...Amadeus!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Jesus! They play this song, like, twenty fucking times a day.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Fucking sadists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The park is closing. “Who’s Johnny” by El Debarge (the hi song from “Short Circuit”) plays as patrons exit. TRACK WITH James as he walks. He stops abruptly. He leans down to pick up:

dialogues.speaker: A CHAINED BICYCLE WHEEL
dialogues.text: that is no longer attached to a bicycle.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 30 EXT. “LOVE MACHINE” RIDE, ADVENTURELAND - MOMENTS LATE James, carrying the wheel, walks over to Frigo, who’s clo the ride down for the evening.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Frigo. Can I get a ride with you? Someone stole my bike. Well, three- quarters of it.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Ha-ah, Brennan! You’re such a nutsack!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Should I interpret that as a yes? Frigo moves behind a little booth, unzips his pants and starts pissing.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Frigo?

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: I can’t hold it. So lend me five bucks.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: You want a ride home? James sighs as he reaches for his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Joel stand with a group of co-workers, includin Frigo and Munch. Joel takes a pipe out of his pocket. He stuffs it with tobacco and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: (off of James’s look) I know it’s a revolting affectation, but it relaxes me. Em saunters over to them. She has changed into a concert for the punk band “The Damned”. She leans close to reveal that she has a PINT BOTTLE OF BACARDI in her coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Want some?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Sure. Suddenly, the nearby co-workers scream loudly. 23. 30 31  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 24. 31

dialogues.speaker: CO-WORKERS
dialogues.text: (in unison) Wet Fart! Wet Fart! Wet Fart!

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: No it wasn’t!

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Check his undies!! James is at his breaking point:

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I’m...I’m supposed to be in the Caravaggio room at the Uffizi or running with the bulls in Pamplona! Who swapped lives with me? How did I end up here?!

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Welcome to the fucked. Cheers. Frigo turns his attention to James.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Hey, Brennan, did you know about Connell?!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: He once friggin’ jammed with Neil Young!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Seriously? SUE O'MALLEY, a tall, cute-ish, red-haired girl, pipes in SUE O’MALLEY It’s totally true! Connell is so friggin’ excellent!

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: ...friggin’ major!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: He played with Neil Young?! Tell me-

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Brennan, did you know Connell’s got a rock band? They’re called ‘Enemas’.

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: (pointing at his t-shirt) It’s ‘Animus’, you moron. Uh-doy.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 25.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Shut up, Munch, you munchkin! I bet Connell gets tons of pussy!

dialogues.speaker: SUE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: He’s married, you perv! As this illuminating discussion continues, a rusty blue P pulls up beside them. Pete O’Malley, the jerk who threw James's book into the boat pond, leans his head out a win

dialogues.speaker: PETE O'MALLEY, (TO JOEL)
dialogues.text: Nice pipe, grandpa! Pete throws something out of the car. It nails Joel in th head.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Ow. I think that was a corn dog.

dialogues.speaker: SUE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: Sorry, Joel. My brother’s kind of a douche. An enormous puke-colored Cutlass Supreme pulls into the l In the driver’s seat is MRS. FRIGO, a squat Italian woman Rosary beads dangle from the rear-view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Brennan, you panty stain! Let’s go!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (sighing to Em) That’s my cue.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: I can give you a lift.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Really? (turning) Hey, Frigo, I got a ride.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: You got a ride?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yes, I got a ride.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Why don’t you ride this? Frigo punches James in the groin. James crumples to the ground. Frigo cackles as he skitters away.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 31 32 33

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (through the pain) It’s just my life.
31 32 The proto-punk classic “Roadrunner” by Jonathan Richman & Modern Lovers starts playing. Em and James her Pacer. She cranks the music up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Em pulls up to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Well...thanks for the ride. James starts to get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: You in a hurry?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: No. I’m...no. (awkward beat) are driving in 33 So, did Connell really jam with Neil Young?

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Yeah, he did. At a club in the city. Connell’s actually really talented. Want some? She hands him the Bacardi. He glances toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (looking toward his house) Oh, Jesus. JAMES’S P.O.V. His mother squints at him through a window.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: My mother. She’s very nosy. She read my journals. I had to start them in French. Okay, she’s gone. He slugs down some Bacardi. used to writing  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 27.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Joel told me that you’re going to grad school. Columbia? What for?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Journalism.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Oh, really?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I want to be, like, a travel essayist. Report on the real state of the world. Like, okay, Charles Dickens wrote what you might call ‘travel books’ -- but he visited prisons and mental asylums.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: That’s cool.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Well, we don’t have to accept the world as it is. We can shine a light on, y'know, cruelty, disparity. We can say: I’m not settling for this crap. Things can be better. Em nods -- not entirely convinced, though.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You’re going into your senior year, right? What’s your major?

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: It'll probably be art history. It doesn’t matter. I mean, I can’t really picture myself in a profession. I don’t really like being part of...anything.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You’re a lone wolf.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Yeh. That’s me. 34 EXT. DANNY’S BAR, STRIP MALL - LATER 34 Em is driving alone. She slows down, looking over at DANNY'S, an undistinguished nightclub/bar. A back-lit sig (missing some letters) reads:

dialogues.speaker: TUMBLING DIC
dialogues.text: EM’S P.O.V. -- a green Plymouth Duster in the parking lot  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 28. 34 35 36 37

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Em drives into the lot and parks. She crosses to the dive bar and enters. MUSIC: “Tops” by the Rolling Stones starts to play...

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA TRACKS WITH
dialogues.text: an unusually buxom and shapely 19-year-old woman. She has olive skin, flowing jet black hair and striking dark eyes She wears tight jeans and an orange “RIDES” shirt that is tied off to expose her midsection. She’s LISA P.

dialogues.speaker: MICK JAGGER SINGS
dialogues.text: -.--Cause I'll take you to the top, baby...I swear we're never going to stop, baby...I'll take you to the top... VARIOUS MALES REACT TO HER -- a group of boy scouts ogle punch each other, a dad furtively checks her out, an awkw teen stumbles into a cotton candy cart. INT. “GAMES PALACE” ARCADE, ADVENTURELAND - CONTINUOUS 36 James works the arcade. Munch scurries up to a co-worker.

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: Lisa P.’s back!

dialogues.speaker: CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: (astonished)

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: (running toward James) Brennan! Lisa P.’s back!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Who's Lisa P.?

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: Holy mother of crap! Who’s Lisa P.?! James watches quizzically as Munch runs on to the next ma to pass along the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa P. is holding court with several co-workers. Her presence has them electrified.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ON
dialogues.text: Joel behind the counter of the “milk can toss” booth. Jam stands outside the booth. They’re staring at Lisa P.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 29.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Look at the shape of her ass. It’s a Platonic ideal. That ass is a higher truth. Look, look! See how there’s that little portal of light just below her crotch. Where the thigh meets the pudendum.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Pudendum?

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: --.-I’m telling you, I’ve had dreams about that diamond-shaped portal... Shit, she’s coming over here! Be cool!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You’re telling me to be cool? As Lisa P.’s group breaks up, she saunters toward Joel an James, along with her friend, KELLY, a blonde girl. They' eating sno-cones. LISA P. Hey, Joel.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: (nervously) Hey, Lisa. I didn’t expect to see you back. LISA P. Oh, man, I had my whole summer, like, Mapped out. Beach by day, dancing by night. But my dad, he got sick. He had this whole, like, heart operation. I mean, I need to help out, y’know?

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to hear that. (apropos of nothing) My mom has shingles. LISA P. Oh.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: So does anyone ever win this game?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: The trick is to underhand it, with your palm toward you. It gives you backspin. LISA P. Yeah?  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 30.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Then when the ball hits the lip of the milk can, it catches. Like this. James tosses a ball. It bounces off the lip of the milk c and doesn't go in.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: (into a microphone, loudly) And we have a loser.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I mean, it takes a few tries. Ha. LISA P. Well, we gotta go run the ‘Love Machine’. Don’t want Paulette bitchin’ me out my first night back. (to James, with a little smile) I’m Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: James. The boys watch as Lisa P. walk away. Joel looks like he might cry. 38 INT. “GAMES PALACE” ARCADE, ADVENTURELAND - LATER 38 James stands beside Joel as he plays a video game.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: (narrating his play) Ah-ha! The smart bomb! Fuuuck! See, okay, yes, observe. I have two options. I could play it safe, cower back here and pick off marauders... (starts tapping buttons wildly) Or I could rush into the breach, guns blazing... Make a run right at the cortex!!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Your shields are almost gone...

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: .-.-And bombs away! An explosion sound -- Joel’s ‘strategy’ has succeeded.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Audentis Fortuna Iuvat. Fortune favors the bold. Virgil said that.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 31.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I’m sure Virgil had ‘Bionic Commando’ in mind. As Joel attacks the next level, James notices two burly, TOUGH TEENAGE BOYS playing a nearby video game. A sweet- looking, RUNTY BOY, is trying to watch.

dialogues.speaker: RUNTY BOY
dialogues.text: Can I play?

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH TEENAGER
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: RUNTY BOY
dialogues.text: Can I have a quarter?

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH TEENAGER
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) Ah, shit! Eat fire-dick, sucka!!

dialogues.speaker: RUNTY BOY
dialogues.text: But Dad said-

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH TEENAGER
dialogues.text: I said fuck off! The runty boy wanders off, pouting. James takes out his wallet, pulls out a few singles. He stuffs them into his change apron, counts out a bunch of quarters.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (to the kid) Hey, kid. Here, have some fun. James holds out his hand. The kid looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It's okay. Go nuts. The kid grins and takes the money. He runs back to his brother and shows him the quarters. The older boy looks o at James, suspicious and annoyed. He takes the quarters f the kid and pockets them. The runty boy looks stricken.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Fuck. (walking toward the kids) Hey, that money is his. The teenager turns toward James. He looks pissed.

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH TEENAGER
dialogues.text: What? Joel looks up from the game, surprised.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 32.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I...I just gave him that money. The teenager starts toward James, menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH TEENAGER
dialogues.text: Are you accusing me?

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: (to himself) Fuuuck. The teen’s expression is borderline psychotic. People hav turned to watch -- INCLUDING EM, who has just entered fro the snack bar. James can see her, over the teen’s shoulde

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH TEENAGER
dialogues.text: (still moving forward) I’m gonna fucking beat you. You hear me? I’m gonna hurt you. Right now.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Okay. I can’t win a fight with you. I know that. (turning to Joel) If I have a seizure, get the syringe from my locker. It has insulin. If I don’t have the insulin, it could be fatal.

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH TEENAGER
dialogues.text: What? What the fuck?!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (turning back) I have a condition.

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH TEENAGER
dialogues.text: (confused and irritated) You have...you have...I...? (almost helpless) You fuckin’ pussy. He turns and walks away. Joel exhales, deeply relieved.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: (aside to James) You made that up? I mean, we don’t have lockers...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: Heh-heh! Brennan’s got a condition!!  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 33. 38 39 40

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: James sees that Em has taken this all in. She gives hima sympathetic look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: Generation X’s punk rock cover of John Lennon’s “G Some Truth”. The camera is mounted to the “hood” of a bumper car and ZOOMING TOWARD James, a sitting duck in his bumper car. THE CAMERA IS JOLTED as James is sent spinning, sparks raining down. Em grins as she drives away from the scene the crime. James gives pursuit. He’s about to hit Em, when she veers the last second. James slams into a FRECKLED KID. The kid stares him down as he drives off. Em taunts James from afar, driving in circles. James catc up to her ... BUT THEN: the freckled kid is coming straig at him. They CRASH. James is thrown forward. A split- second later, he’s WHIPLASHED BACKWARD as another kid hit him. Then another. And another. Em laughs as every kid on the ride pummels James... EXT. “SHOOT OUT THE STAR” GAME - ANOTHER DAY 40 General Public’s “Tenderness” plays as three LOUD KIDS ar fighting over the BB gun.

dialogues.speaker: LOUD KID
dialogues.text: C'mon, it’s my turn, fartstain!

dialogues.speaker: LOUD KID
dialogues.text: No it’s not, dickweed!

dialogues.speaker: LOUD KID
dialogues.text: (holding his head) That ride made me dizzy! Did that ride make you dizzy...?! James yawns. Beside him, Connell is repairing one of the guns.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES

dialogues.text: (entering) You know me. I’11 keep it down. He gives her a kiss on the cheek. CONNELL’S MOTHER Okay, honey... 66 EXT. BACKYARD, CONNELL’S MOTHER’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATE Connell reappears at the back door. He lets Em into the house. 67 INT. MUD ROOM, CONNELL’S MOTHER’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 6 They quietly cross to the basement doorway and enter... 68 INT. BASEMENT, CONNELL’S MOTHER’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 6 They descend into a wood-panelled basement, his adolescen sanctuary -- rock posters, an air hockey table, a weight bench, a few guitars. He clicks on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Want a beer?

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Got anything stronger? He holds up a bottle of Jack Daniels. She nods. Connell opens a small fridge, to get ice. He pours two drinks.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: What excuse did you give your mother for coming down here? Gotta pump some midnight iron?

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Sometimes I come over here to practice. Give Ronnie a break. He leans in and kisses her neck. She pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Are you still hot for your wife? What’s the sex like?  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 52. 68 69 70

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Don’t. Don’t be mean.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Geez, you’re sensitive.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Em, I’m serious. Let’s not make it like all the other shit out there. When we’re together, we’re good to each other. Let’s not ruin it. They stare at each other for a few tense moments.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Okay. She moves into his arms, burying her head into his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paulette, looking grouchy in an Uncle Sam hat, points park-goers toward a sign that reads:

dialogues.speaker: FIREWORKS 2NITE
dialogues.text: INT. “GAMES PALACE” ARCADE, ADVENTURELAND - CONTINUOUS 70 Lisa P. plays “Pole Position”, a sit-down race car video game. She notices James at the adjacent game, trying to clean some gum out of a coin slot with a popsicle stick. LISA P. Hey, James.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Bonus lap. Kudos. LISA P. (lowering her voice) I heard you might have some weed?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (trying to be cool) I’ve got a stash. You like the ganja? LISA P. Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hold on. He looks around, acting suspicious. He takes out his wall He slips Lisa P. a small, crumpled joint.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 53. 70 71

dialogues.speaker: LISA P.
dialogues.text: I can have this?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: No prob. LISA P. (smiling) Nice. Maybe we should go on break?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off to the side of the ride, are some broken down antique buggies. James sits in the front seat of one, Lisa P. lie across the back seat, discreetly smoking the joint.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: .-..-I was supposed to go to Europe. It was a graduation present from my parents. Then my dad’s company had all these cutbacks, he got demoted, they couldn’t afford it anymore. So, here I am. LISA P. (takes a toke, beat) My dad’s really sick.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. LISA P. Want some?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. Okay. He takes a tiny toke. LISA P. It’s hard to see him like that. Not for me, for him. He doesn’t like being seen that way. Y'know, weak.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Men are very proud. LISA P. Yeah. Exactly. Do you believe in God?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (caught off guard) Um. Wow. Theology usually doesn’t come up around here a lot.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 54. 71 72

dialogues.speaker: LISA P.
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you see someone you love get really sick, you think about that.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Right, see -- I’m not a devout Catholic, but I believe in love. That there’s something divine in the human capacity to love. LISA P. That’s pretty cool. (nodding thoughtfully, then) I’m majorly high.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (worried) Oh, shit. Me, too. She starts to giggle like crazy. EXT. “THE FLIGHING DUTCHMAN!” BOOTH - THAT NIGHT 72 Crowds have gathered for the fireworks. Em and Sue O’Mall work the booth, James stands outside the booth, reading a newspaper. He’s manic from getting stoned:

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Secord admitted that they were shredding documents after the investigation began!

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (incensed) No fucking way!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: That’s what he testified! Those fuckers!

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Scumbags! SUE O’MALLEY What are you guys talkin’...?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Iran-contra hearings. Sue shrugs, no idea what he’s talking about. Something catches both Em and James’s attention:

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL AND HIS WIFE
dialogues.text: are strolling along the midway. She’s dressed in a tacky- sexy cocktail waitress get-up. She holds their baby boy.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 55. 72 73 74 75

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Why is she dressed like that?

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: She works at that lame disco, Razzmatazz. SUE O’MALLEY (partially overhearing) You don’t like Razzmatazz?! A bunch of us are going the tuesday after next. It’s two-fer tuesday. Two drinks for the price of one!! You guys gotta go. Sue gets called away by a customer.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (still watching Connell’s wife) It’s kinda sad.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What? Razzmatazz? No. their marriage. He didn’t really want it. Now he’s trapped.

dialogues.speaker: A LOUD WHISTLE AND BOOM
dialogues.text: The first volley of fire works have begun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby fumbles with an audio cassette.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Shit! I wasn’t ready!! He jams the cassette into a player and hits play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVER THE LOUDSPEAKERS, we hear Meco’s disco-fied version the “Star Wars Theme”. James, Em and Sue stare up at the fireworks as the crowd ooh’s and ah’s. Em subtly looks over at Connell. He turns and locks eyes with her. HOLD ON this loaded exchange of looks... SUPER WIDE ON the park, fireworks exploding above...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parking lot is empty, except for Em’s Pacer.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE CAR -- James and Em are kissing. She grabs his crotch. He jumps.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: No, no -- no reason to be sorry.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (looking right at him) Can I touch you?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Absolutely. She “touches” him, while they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: A WIFFLE BALL BAT
dialogues.text: raps at the window.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Ah! Rich, the parking lot attendant, is peering down at them. James covers himself up as Em rolls down the window.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Rich, you scared the hell out of us. He’s looking past James, at Em.

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: The park’s closed. Em.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: I know, Rich.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Rich, it’s me, James.

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: The park’s closed, James.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're leaving soon.

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: You better leave now. I don’t want you to get in trouble. The park’s closed.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Okay. Gotcha. Good-night, Rich. They drive off. 75 56.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 57. 76

dialogues.speaker: ON A TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: Oliver North, fervently testifying before the senate...

dialogues.speaker: MEANWHILE
dialogues.text: James is on top of Em, making out, fully dry-humping. The are practically exploding with hormones.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (leaning close) I think we should get naked.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (beat) Yes. Yes, I concur. Upstairs?

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Here. Now. Em unbuttons James’s pants. She starts to pull them down.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Wait. Shoes. He starts to get his shoes off. She does the same. From t other room, we hear a DOOR OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Fuck! They’re early! Em pushes James off -- he rolls onto the floor with a THU He struggles to pull up his pants as fast as possible. Em reaches to turn on a lamp, knocking it over -- she catche just in time and sets it right. James hops onto the couch beside Em, pulling a pillow over his lap to hide his hard just as MR. LEWIN enters. He’s followed by Em’s stepmothe FRANCY, gaunt, with a big, fake smile. They’re dressed up James is wearing only one sneaker.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY
dialogues.text: (with creepy enthusiasm) Heeeyyy, Kiiids!

dialogues.speaker: MR. LEWIN
dialogues.text: (brusquely) Hey. What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Dad, this is my friend, James. James starts to get up -- but his erection makes it awkwa  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 58. 76

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (halfway standing) Hello. Sir.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY
dialogues.text: Hi, James. Nice to meet you. Mr. Lewin stares blankly at the TV screen for a moment. James tries to not stare at Francy’s wig.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LEWIN
dialogues.text: Well, I need to do some work before bed. Good-night. He trudges out.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY
dialogues.text: So it was a lovely party at the Melnicks. They’ve done a beautiful job on their backyard. Added a fountain. Anda pergola. Just gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (couldn’t give a shit) Sounds magical.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY
dialogues.text: Their daughter, Lori, is lovely. She said you two used to be best friends?!

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: In junior high. She used to sleep over.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY
dialogues.text: How nice. EM (to James) Lori Melnick once violated our cat, Gypsy, with a ballpoint pen.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY
dialogues.text: Emily!

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: She was just, like, ‘hey, check this out’ and started to pleasure the cat. It was kinda weird. Does that make me an accessory to cat rape?

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY
dialogues.text: Young lady! That’s enough! Francy huffs with disgust as she exits.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 59. 76 77 78 79

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (irritated) Ugh. Let’s get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’re in a field that’s crisscrossed by colossal high-ten wire towers. Em sits on the hood of the car and lights a cigarette. James throws back some Bacardi. “Willpower” by The Replacements plays from the car.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: I don’t give a shit about the Melnicks and their fucking pergola! She can’t imagine that people might value something in this world other than money and the ugly shit that it buys! I just can’t believe that’s who my dad would choose to be with! Em takes the bottle from James and drinks.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) When my mom got sick -- really sick -- my dad suddenly started going to temple. Like every night. He was never serious about his faith. But, you know, he was gonna buddy up to God, ask him to save my mother. (laughing bitterly) But he wasn’t at temple. He was actually having...relations with that creature. She looks off, doesn’t want to make eye contact with Jame

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: My mom lost her hair because of chemo. And my father started sleeping with a bald woman. (beat) Fucking weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the disco classic “Rock Your Baby” by George McCrae pl Lisa P. and her friend Kelly do a sultry dance in front o the Gravitron ride. Every male within a hundred yards is gawking at this show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby stares out the window, looking wistful. He’s watchi Lisa P.’s gyrating ass. He gulps from a can of beer.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 60.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It’s nice when Paulette’s got a day off, huh? So I can put on the disco station. Connell sits near Bobby, making some repairs on the P.A. system.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Tell me one of your stories...

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Oh, christ...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Wait, tell me trifecta day again! Which one did you do first? The brunette babe with bangs and the white shorts and the birth mark right inside her thigh, right?

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Bobby, you know these stories better than I do. James enters. Bobby nearly falls out of his chair, trying hide his beer.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hey, Brennan.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (handing over ticket apron) I’m on break. The phone rings. BOBBY (into phone) Hello? (to Connell) It’s your mother. Connell sighs. He takes the phone. We faintly hear a distressed-sounding voice on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL, (INTO PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hey, ma...it’s okay...I’ll...alright, ma, I'll come over...don’t...I know, I know...I gotta...I’1l be right there. He hangs up, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: I gotta go. (nods to James to follow him) Jimbo.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James follows Connell out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: You got one of those little baby joints on you?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: I could use that. Let’s go for a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James drives with Connell in the Duster. Connell lights u the joint.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Your mom okay?

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: (lighting up) My mother’s over three hundred pounds, half-blind from diabetes. She’s also got arthritis and emphysema. And now she can’t control her bowels. Personally, I’d rather be dead.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I’m sorry... Connell hands the joint to James, who takes a hit. He hol in the smoke, determined to not cough. James waits a beat, as if to see if he’s stoned already. slowly takes in the song on the radio -- it’s a languorou guitar-heavy Neil Young song. James turns the volume up.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: (listening to the song) That’s cool...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It’s Neil Young.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Oh. Right.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Cortez the Killer.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Yeh-yeh.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 62. 81 82

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Connell sucks on the joint and hands it back to James.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You gotta tell me your Neil Young story. He’s, like, a real hero to me. Oh, shit- James suddenly ducks down in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Cop car.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Uh, desperado, it’s a driving school car.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (sitting back up) Oh. So you going tonight?

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Razzmatazz? Not really my scene. How goes it with Em?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It’s going...she’s...it’s been... (beat) I think I’m in love with her. Connell, surprised, looks over at James, who obliviously takes another hit...then starts coughing up his lungs. INT. “GAMES PALACE” ARCADE, ADVENTURELAND - LATER 82 Em is making change for some gruff, chain-smoking old wom who are playing “Fascination”, a Bingo-like game. Em spot Connell close by, repairing a skee ball machine. She stro toward him as he pitches some balls to test the machine.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: I was hanging with your boyfriend today.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: He’s not my boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: He told me that he’s in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (surprised by this) What?

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: He said: “I think I’m in love with her”.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 63. 82 83 84 85

dialogues.speaker: OLD LADY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Excuse me! Miss! Young lady! One of the old ladies is frantically waving some dollars Em. She walks to her, a bit perturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: “LET THE MUSIC PLAY” by SHANNON A TRACKING SHOT of a fast-moving caravan of cars. Em’s ca is the leader of the pack. EXT. PARKING LOT, “RAZZMATAZZ” DANCE CLUB - NIGHT 84 A shopping mall parking lot, beneath a glowing sign that reads “RAZZMATAZZ”.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA FOLLOWS
dialogues.text: James, Em, Joel and Sue O'Malley as they pass through the front doors of the nightclub. INT. “RAZZMATAZZ"” DANCE CLUB - CONTINUOUS 85 The club is packed, the music (Shannon still) is very lou Every surface is either carpeted, mirrored or painted bla Em is taking it all in. She notices the slack-jawed faces of Pete O’Malley and hi pals -- they’re hypnotized by Lisa P., who’s on the dance floor, doing a synchronized hip-swaying dance with Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: This place is vile. As they cross to the bar, Em spots Connell’s wife nearby. She’s serving cocktails to a table of smitten guys. As sh moves away from the table, she recognizes James and Em. S puts on a smile, but it takes some effort:

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s Adventureland night! What can I get ya?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Four gin and tonics.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Four g-and-t’s...

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Make it eight. (off the others’ looks) It’s two-fer night.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 64. 86 INT. “RAZZMATAZZ” DANCE CLUB - LATER 86 We find the foursome in a big, curved booth littered with cocktail glasses. Joel is in conversation with Sue. SUE O’MALLEY What are you majoring in?

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Russian literature and Slavic languages. SUE O’MALLEY Wow. That’s interesting. What career track is that?

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Cabbie. Hot dog vendor. Marijuana delivery guy. The world’s my oyster. A NEW SONG STARTS: “I CAN’T WAIT” by NU SHOOZ Around them, there’s a rush to the dance floor. Sue drunkenly jumps up from her seat. SUE O’MALLEY C'mon! Let’s dance! Em! Em doesn’t look enthused. James stands, taking her hand.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Come on. Em doesn’t budge.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Come on! James pulls the reluctant Em up from the booth and onto t dance floor. As they start to dance, James surprises Em b grabbing her hand and spinning her into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Marci Feingold, ninth grade, taught me that one. Lisa P. is right beside them. LISA P. Nice moves, Brennan.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 65. 87 EXT. PARKING LOT, “RAZZMATAZZ” DANCE CLUB - NIGHT 87 Joel stumbles alongside the very wasted Sue, who’s doing silly jazz dance moves.

dialogues.speaker: SUE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: Razzmatazz! Razzma-tazzzzzz!

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Come on, Razzmatazz, I’m driving you home.

dialogues.speaker: SUE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: We love you, Razzmatazz! She spins around and falls down.

dialogues.speaker: SUE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: (as if cursing) Razzmatazz! Joel helps her up.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: SUE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: Ooh. You’re strong...ish. That’s so...Razzmatazz. She leans on Joel as they walk toward Em’s car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back seat of Em’s parked car: Joel and Sue are sloppily making out. Out on the beach, James and Em sit o the lifeguard stand. He wears a drunk, fretful look.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I need to tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I know I said...we both said...I’ve changed my...I feel differently...about you, about us... Em looks off at the surf. Her expression clouds over.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: I don’t know...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What don’t you know?  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 66. 88 89

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: There’s a lot of shit in my life, James. You have no idea...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Em, I think I do. I...I want to be there for you. She looks at him, so much happening in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You think you can do everything alone. But you don’t have to... I know you must be so disappointed with your father-

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: It’s late. With that, she hops off the lifeguard stand and heads bac the car. He follows, a few steps behind.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Em...? She looks at him, then gets in the car. EXT. “HATS OFF TO LARRY” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - DAY 89 PSSSHHHHH... An aerosol can sprays toward camera. WIDER -- Paulette is spraying adhesive on one of the “Lar Mannequin heads. She glues a hat on it. It’s morning at Adventureland. James walks past, drinking some coffee. He sees Lisa P., struggling to drag a heavy wooden sign -- it’s a cut-out a cartoon pirate, saying: “MATEYS MUST BE THIS TALL TO RI

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Here, let me help. He puts down his coffee and helps her move the sign to th front of the entrance to the “Enterprise” ride. LISA P. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: How's your dad? LISA P. Slow going, but he’s hanging in there. Thanks.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 67. 89

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She inserts a key into a control box and turns it. She starts up the ride engine, which makes some disturbing scraping, clanking sounds.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (concerned) These rides are safe, right? LISA P. Supposedly. I definitely wouldn’t fuck around on any of ‘em. Last summer, some drunk idiot was goofing around on the Galaxy, trying to kick his buddy. They found his Reebok in the parking lot. With his foot in it. Pete O'Malley saunters over, eating a breakfast slice of pizza.

dialogues.speaker: PETE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, Lisa. We’re partners today. He gives James a disinterested nod.

dialogues.speaker: PETE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: So it’s official. My friend Boomer’s hooking me up with a job at the Mercedes dealership on Jericho Turnpike. I’m totally psyched. LISA P. (unimpressed) Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: PETE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: I get a car right away. Way under list price, payments deducted from my check. I’m gonna go for a 560, convertible, in gold, with leather interior, all the options. I’m even gonna get a compact disc player. Gonna be insane. LISA P. To the max. PETE O’MALLEY So, hey, Lise -- you wanna go see Judas Priest at Nassau Coliseum? My friend Fitzy can get me floor seats. LISA P. That’s okay. Take Boomer. I don’t mind. And go tell Bobby we need to hose down the dried puke over there.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 68.

dialogues.speaker: PETE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: You don’t like Priest? LISA P. I’m busy that night.

dialogues.speaker: PETE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: I didn’t tell you what night. LISA P. (ignoring him) James, you and I should go out some night. James is speechless. So is Pete.

dialogues.speaker: PETE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: (cracking up) I get it! Funny one! Psych!! LISA P. (looking at James) Just let me know. Pete -- dried puke. Pete gives James a dirty look as he walks off. LISA P. I’m serious. I wouldn’t mind hanging out with a nice guy for a change.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Cool. That would be very cool. He turns and walks right into the pirate sign. He steadie it, smiles at Lisa P. and walks away. 90 EXT. “SKY CHOPPER” RIDE, ADVENTURELAND - A BIT LATER 9 Connell is attempting to repair the “Sky Chopper” ride, hunched over the motor casing. James stands beside him, l in thought. Customers are starting to trickle in.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Give me the needle-nose. James fishes through a toolbox, hands over the pliers.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Lisa P. just asked me if I wanted to go out with her some time-  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 69. 90

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Lisa P.?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know. She may’ve been trying to piss off Pete O'Malley, but... (beat) +..Can you imagine any universe in which she'd get with a guy like me?

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Do you own a Corvette or, like, a publishing empire?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I’m taking that as a no.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Connell! ANGLE ON Bobby, who mans the nearby ride controls.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Let's try again.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I think we should maybe wait until we can get Monty down here-

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’m gonna start it. Connell backs away from the motor. Bobby starts the ride. The “chopper” gondolas are hoisted into the air...

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: See. It’s fine. Would be dumb to shut this baby down. A solid ticket-seller. Connell looks at James.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Look, my attitude is you never know. She asked you out? You’re a fucking idiot if you don’t at least go. She’s Lisa P.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: But it’s crazy. I don’t have a shot.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: You never know. She’s a Catholic prude. Your sensitive guy bullshit might help for a change. But don’t be too nice.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 70. 90 91

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: But what about Em?

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: What about her?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Well, I...I can’t do that to her.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: She doesn’t need to know. Look, are you getting all of your needs met by Em?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Uh. I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Right. You see a beautiful young thing, every cell in your body screams at you to go after her. That’s how we’re wired. It’s stupid to deny it.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: But my feelings for Em are...vast.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: (rolling his eyes) Good for you. But James. Imagine it. Lisa P.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Right. Lisa P.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: A DEAFENING SCREECH, followed by the METALLIC THWACK of a cable snapping. A fiberglass gondola comes crashing to th ground just a few yards from them. Various patrons are frozen in their tracks, a child bursts into tears.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It’s okay, folks! Ha ha! Ride’s closed for repairs! Go about your fun! Lots of other fun, everywhere you look! Hooray!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel, carrying a few paperbacks, tentatively approaches S as she eats a pretzel and french fry breakfast. “(I Just) Died In Your Arms” by Cutting Crew plays.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Hey. SUE O’MALLEY Joel. Hey.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 71. 91 92

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: I brought you this. One of my favorite writers. Gogol. Russian. Lost his mind, burned the only copy of final book, nine days later died of self-starvation. A real fun guy. He laughs awkwardly as he hands her the book. SUE O’MALLEY Oh. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Um, so, maybe you want to see a dumb movie or something, some time?

dialogues.speaker: SUE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: (uneasily) Well, the thing is, I, uh...I did something kinda stupid? (beat) I told my brother that we made out.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Oh. That’s...bad? Does he want to... hurt me?

dialogues.speaker: SUE O'MALLEY
