dialogues.text: No, no. But he, uh, he told my parents. Joel doesn’t follow.

dialogues.speaker: SUE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: Well...we’re Catholic. (beat, spelling it out) Pete told my parents that you’re Jewish.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: But...but I’m an atheist. More of a pragmatic nihilist, I guess. An existential pagan, if you will-

dialogues.speaker: SUE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Yeah, my parents are kinda really strict. I’m sorry. Sue walks away, leaving behind the Gogol book. EXT. “ENTERPRISE” RIDE, ADVENTURELAND - DAY 92 Pete O'Malley straps the last patrons into a car, gives Lisa P. a thumbs-up. She starts the ride. REVERSE ON James, watching, steeling himself.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 92 93 94

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (to himself) Fortune favors the bold. James strides over to Lisa P. ... INT. “GAMES PALACE” ARCADE, ADVENTURELAND - LATER James looks highly anxious as he stands beside Joel, who’ mastering another video game.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: The mutant knights are particularly vulnerable to rear attacks... Bam! Ha, child’s play...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Okay, look, you can’t tell anyone. I’m going out with Lisa P. tonight.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: You’re what?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: This morning, she asked me if I wanted to hang out some night. Joel is dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: (quietly) fuuuck.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Look, nothing’s going to happen. But then again, you never know, right? I mean, I have to try. It’s Lisa P.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: (a little bitter) I can’t even get the time of day from Sue O'Malley and you already have Em... Wow. You're quite the swain.
92 93 94 James stands with Frigo, waiting for their ride. James lo twitchy and impatient.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Where’s my mom?!

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: What’s the rush? You got a date with a jar of vaseline and a dildo?  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 73.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Funny. (can’t keep it to himself) You can’t tell anyone, Frigo. But I do have a date tonight. With Lisa P.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Yeah, and I can crap golden eggs.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Fine. Don’t believe me.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: The Velvet Touch.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: (still doesn’t believe him) Eat my dick cheese, Brennan.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I enjoy our little talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Em is punching in. As she exits the office, she sees Joel stacking boxes down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Hey. How did it go with Sue? Joel looks down, humiliated.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. SNACK BAR, ADVENTURELAND
dialogues.text: Em & Joel stand in the snack bar. She looks outraged.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Don’t...don’t say anything!

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Fuck that!

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: C'mon. Worse things have happened to the Jews. Em crosses to the door, pushes it open, and marches up to O'Malley, who sits at an outdoor table with friends. Joel hides behind the door, watching.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: You know what?! You don’t deserve to date Joel!  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 74. 96 97 98

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: EM (cont'd) Cause you’re an anti-semitic asshole! What, do you hate gay people, too? Do you support apartheid? Sue is speechless. She coughs on her soda.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: You’re not my friend. Em turns and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An illuminated “faux-classy” sign over a storefront restaurant reads:

dialogues.speaker: THE VELVET TOUCH
dialogues.text: James, looking like the staid college guy in a pressed bu down oxford, opens the door for Lisa P. She’s in a low-cu halter top and skin-tight jeans. They’re a mismatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various men and waiters are ogling Lisa P. as he nervousl scans the menu.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: So, I, uh, would prefer if we didn’t tell a lot of people about tonight. There's someone at the park who has a little thing for me, I wouldn’t want to make her feel bad. LISA P. You mean Em?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Uh. Yeah. LISA P. So you guys aren’t going out?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: No, just friends. (faux cocky) A little more than friends, but we’re not a couple. LISA P. Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (changing the subject) I saw Connell play a few weeks ago. He's really talented.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 75. 98

dialogues.speaker: LISA P.
dialogues.text: That guy has some problems.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What do you mean? LISA P. Last summer, he was having this thing with this girl who worked in the snack bar. He used to take her to his mother’s basement, so they could have sex. His mother’s basement. How gross is that?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: But he’s married. LISA P. Didn’t stop him from hitting on me.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I...wow... Just as James begins to ponder this disturbing informatio

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yo, Brennan! James and Lisa P. turn around. FRIGO STANDS AT THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: (mouthing) Holy shit! LISA P. Is that Frigo?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What’s he doing here? James hurries over to Frigo.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Holy shit! That’s Lisa P.!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (faking surprise) What are you doing here, Frigo?!

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Promise me you’ll suck those titties! James grabs Frigo and ushers him out the door  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 76. 99 100 101

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: I thought you were full of crap!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Get lost, Frigo! And you can’t tell anyone about this!

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: What’s it worth to you?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You’re shaking me down?! INT. WINE & CHEESE BAR, STRIP MALL — CONTINUOUS 100 Lisa P. is still reading the menu. Behind her, we see Jam hand a twenty to Frigo. As James puts his wallet away, Fr punches him in the nuts. James collapses out of sight. Frigo runs off. After a moment, James rises slowly into frame. He re-ente the restaurant, walking oddly. He forces a smile as he si re-joins Lisa P.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (swallowing the pain) What a coincidence! Frigo was going to Carvel and saw us through the window. (picking up the menu) I wonder how the fondue is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Lisa P. stand on a pier. She’s lighting one of paltry joints.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: After Columbia, who knows. I want a job that takes me places. I want to travel all over the country, all over the world, and write about it. We don’t have to accept the world as it is, right? For instance, Charles Dickens wrote all about his travels and- LISA P. (hasn’t been listening) Would you rather have a sailboat or a speedboat?  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 77.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Um. Gee... LISA P. Sailboats are probably cooler. They're, like, more classic. But I bet speedboats are way more fun. I really want to join the Oyster Bay Yacht Club some day. That would rule. (handing him the joint) What were you saying?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Ah, just babbling... 102 EXT. SUBURBAN STREET NEAR LISA P.’S HOUSE - LATER 102 James, very high, is hunched over the wheel, driving slow LISA P. It’s a few houses down.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Where?! LISA P. (glancing at speedometer) You won’t miss it at seventeen miles-an- hour. She starts digging through her purse. LISA P. I just need to, like, get normal before I go inside. I’m gonna put on some perfume, cover the smell... She accidentally knocks her lipstick onto the floor by James's feet. James reaches down to get it.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? He hoists up a half-filled bottle of Cutty Sark whiskey. LISA P. That yours?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (a little disturbed) No. I guess it’s my dad’s... LISA P. Here, pull over here. James pulls over. Lisa P. applies some perfume.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 78.

dialogues.speaker: LISA P.
dialogues.text: Can you smell the pot? James leans over to sniff her. The combination of perfume and proximity to her overwhelms him.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You smell...amazing. LISA P. Thanks for tonight. It was fun.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (almost surprised) Yeah. It was. She lets out a stoned laugh. James does, too. She bites h lower lip. He leans forward and kisses her. LISA P. Hm. Fondue. James reaches up to her ample bosom. He undoes a few butt and kisses her breasts. LISA P. Whoa, tiger. He backs off. LISA P. I have a curfew. Another time. She gives him a tender kiss, then exits the car. 103 INT. JAMES’S BEDROOM, BRENNAN HOUSE - LATER 103 James lies in bed, staring at a photograph, his marijuana altered mind racing. THE PHOTO -- a snapshot of Em in her Buzzcocks t-shirt, wearing a lopsided grin, looking both tough and cute.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (sighing) Fuck. He gets up and crosses to a shelf that displays a few scholastic achievement trophies. He unscrews the bottom o the biggest trophy. From a cavity in the base, he removes the baggie of joints. 104 INT. “GAMES PALACE” ARCADE - NEXT DAY 104 James, clutching a brown paper bag, traverses the arcade, walking toward Em, who plays pinball.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 79.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (tentatively) Hey.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I brought you something. Em turns and looks at him quizzically. He gives her the paper bag. She opens it and she peers in.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Is that a couple of joints?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: For pot cookies. Em grins, surprised. She snatches the bag from him and hi it in her change apron.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Tomorrow night. He walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Shout At The Devil” by Motley Crue is blasting ... WIDE SHOT -- The park is aswarm with suburbanites.

dialogues.speaker: TRACK BY
dialogues.text: Em, Joel and James, who nod and smile too much toward cam

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Paulette is walking by. She fake-smiles back at them.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (the coast is clear) Okay. Let’s do this. She produces the paper bag, removes three large chocolate chip cookies and distributes them. They each take a bite.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Walnuts? Want to see me go into anaphylactic shock?!  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 80. 106 107

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Joel picks out the walnuts as he eats his cookie.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Are you guys eating the whole thing?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (confidently) Sure. Pot hardly fazes me. EXT. “KENTUCKY DERBY” GAME, ADVENTURELAND - NIGHT 107 James is WILDLY, CRAZILY STONED. He’s calling a race for group of small children who are completely inept -- nobod horse is making any progress.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: And red has a slight lead. Yeah. Uhhh...and red still has a slight lead. Looks like blue is...not moving. Looks like nobody’s moving. Time is frozen...like a prehistoric insect, suspended in amber... He trails off. His eyes wander around the vicinity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mixture of faces. Laughing, bored, enchanted, queasy... THE CAMERA LANDS ON Bobby. Staring at James. He lifts the microphone quickly -- it flies out of his ha

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (retrieving the microphone) And what a race we have here today, ladies and gentleman! Hoo boy! And...nobody is in the lead! In fact, what is so mind-blowing about this particular race is how evenly matched these competitors are. Yellow is dead last. I don’t think Yellow has moved once. This is a fall from grace for the this once-great stallion. In fact, Yellow has inseminated over a thousand foals in his lifetime...which might explain his exhaustion. Ha ha... James realizes that Bobby is now right beside him. He jum

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you?! That’s how you call a race?!  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 81. 107 108

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I’ve run out of things to say. These kids can’t get the horses to move. They’re very uncoordinated.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (suspicious) Have you been toking up?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What? No.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (sniffing him) Hm. You sure? Your eyes are red...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Well, I, I feel kinda sick. I think I ate a bad corn dog.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Between us -- never ever eat the corn dogs. Okay, I’1ll put you somewhere else. EXT. “HATS OFF TO LARRY” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - NIGHT 108 James giggles like a moron while he chases after a ball. Overhead, Taco is “Puttin’ on the Ritz”. Meanwhile, Joel and Em are up front, dealing with a large crowd of customers. James runs up, depositing the softbal in a barrel beside Joel, who now starts cracking up for n particular reason.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yo! I’ve been waiting forever! Joel turns to see a scary-looking guy (NICKY), early 20s, stands with his girlfriend and two “Guido” pals.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir. Here you go. Joel hands Nicky some softballs.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (staring Joel down) I want some free balls for waitin’ so long.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: (complying) The customer’s always right. Ha. Nicky tosses a ball. He hits a dummy square on the head. The hat doesn’t budge.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 82. 108

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What?! I hit that thing dead-on!

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Yet he still retains his chapeau-

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: This is bullshit! That was a perfect throw! NICKY’S GIRLFRIEND Nicky, that’s bullshit... Meanwhile, James scampers after loose balls. As he stands WOOSH! A softball whizzes past his head.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Hey, get out of the way, homo! NICKY’S PAL #1 Hit ‘em, Nicky! Nicky launches another pitch toward James. Trying to evade the throw, James runs smack into one of t rotating “Larrys”. The fiberglass dummy snaps off at its base -- James and the mannequin tumble to the ground. Nicky and his friends howl with laughter. Then Nicky noti something odd -- the dummy is still wearing a hat.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What the fuck... Nicky jumps over the counter.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Whoa. Okay, let’s pick you out a prize! Nicky crosses to the broken dummy and yanks on the hat. I stuck to the dummy’s head.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (charging at Joel) It’s glued on! The thing is glued on!

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: (waving at stuffed animals) What would you like? A, uh, puffin? A polar bear in lederhosen? Joel wears an awkward, marijuana-induced smile. Nicky gra him by the shirt.

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: What’s so fucking funny?!  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 83. 108 109

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Leave him alone! The customers (some of whom are drunk) are angrily siding with Nicky. A few even start throwing their softballs at James. He gets beaned by a few. Joel tries to stop smiling -- but he can’t. Nicky suddenly slams his fist into the side of Joel’s hea knocking his glasses off. Joel stumbles backwards, holdin his face. Em rushes at Nicky. James follows her.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: You asshole!

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: Back off, slut! Nicky shoves her away. She loses her footing on the grave and falls.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: est td

dialogues.speaker: NICKY
dialogues.text: (getting in James’s face) What are you gonna do about it, faggot? James, much to his own surprise, roundhouses Nicky in the groin. Nicky crumples to the gravel. Nicky’s pals jump over the counter. NICKY’S PAL #1

dialogues.speaker: GRAB HIM
dialogues.text: NICKY’S PAL #2 YOU'RE FUCKIN’ DEAD! James makes a run for it. He hops over the counter and sprints away. Nicky’s pals pursue him.

dialogues.speaker: FAST WITH JAMES
dialogues.text: weaving through customers. Running for his life. INT. “GAMES PALACE” ARCADE, ADVENTURELAND - CONTINUOUS 11 James barrels through the doorway. He glances back to see one of Nicky’s pals gaining on him.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 84. 110 112

dialogues.speaker: HE LOOKS FORWARD
dialogues.text: His way is blocked by a group of senior citizens. James hurdles over a railing.

dialogues.speaker: HE LANDS BADLY
dialogues.text: and stumbles into Munch, who falls down. Quarters spill from his apron. CHILDREN SQUEAL as they rush for the coins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James dashes into the snack bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to Nicky’s other buddy rushing in through another door. James makes an about-face and hauls ass into the manager’ office. INT. MANAGER’S OFFICE, ADVENTURELAND - NIGHT 112 James enters and slams the door behind him. Bobby jumps, once again trying to hide his can of beer.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What the hell?! What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: People are trying to kill me. James holds the door as Nicky’s friend is KICKING IT. NICKY’S PAL #1 (0.S.) Come out of there, fuck-face!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (sighing) Oh, Christ. Bobby picks up an aluminum baseball bat and opens the doo

dialogues.speaker: A CRAZED LOOK IN HIS EYES
dialogues.text: as he winds up the bat like a baseball player.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Get the fuck away from my office door, motherfucker! Give me a reason! Give me a reason! YOU DON’T KNOW WHAT I’M

dialogues.speaker: CAPABLE OF
dialogues.text: ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 85.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nicky’s pal is stunned. He backs up a few steps -- then hurries off.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (a little freaked by Bobby) Uh...thanks.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (still a wide-eyed psycho) Sure, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrons stream out as Paulette announces over the loudspe that the park is closed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group has assembled around James.

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: I wish I coulda seen you wail on him!

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Did you hit him like this?! Frigo snaps his fist toward James’s groin. James flinches

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Psych! As the others talk excitedly, Em leans close to James.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Come with me a second. She takes his hand and leads him away. Joel stands slightly away from the others. He examines hi eyeglasses, which have been snapped in two, while dabbing a cut near his eye. He holds up one eyeglass lens and squints. He watches Em James slip off behind the arcade building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Em and James enter a fenced-in lot filled with amusement debris -- broken-down go-carts, rusted rocket ship pods, sinister sun-bleached clown statue, etc. Lou Reed’s roman “Coney Island Baby” is playing on the loudspeakers. The p lights shut off, one-by-one...

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Thanks for sticking up for me, Brennan.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 86. 115

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She moves close to him, whispering in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: I think you might be the coolest and cutest guy I’ve ever met. She nuzzles up against his chest.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: But then again, I am still incredibly high. He pulls her close.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: I can feel you...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: How does this feel? He’s touching her.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Pretty...good. He reaches into her jeans...

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah...Oh, God...oh... She leans into his neck...

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Don’t stop...don’t... Em starts to breath in shallow, rhythmic bursts... In the near-darkness, WE HEAR Em having an orgasm... The moans transform into quiet sobs.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Are you...are you okay? We see a glint of light reflecting off of the tears on Em cheek. He holds her against him.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: James?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: I...I don’t want to lose you.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 87. 115

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You won’t. Another set of park lights shut off. James and Em are no longer visible. All we see is the distant ferris wheel. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel sits on a bench, reading Philip Roth’s “Portnoy’s Complaint”. He wears really dorky eyeglasses, an older pa to replace the ones broken in the fight.

dialogues.speaker: A BODY WALKS INTO FRAME
dialogues.text: blocking Joel’s view. Joel looks up. It’s Sue O’Malley’s brother, Pete. He yanks the book out of Joel’s hand and tosses it into the boat pond.

dialogues.speaker: PETE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: Stay away from my sister. And we’re not anti-semites. She just doesn’t like you. He stares Joel down as he stalks away.

dialogues.speaker: PETE O'MALLEY
dialogues.text: I cried in “Yentl”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Fresh” by Kool & The Gang plays above the throngs of amusement-seekers. Bobby stands by the entrance to the sn bar, bobbing his head to the music.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (getting lyrics wrong) She's my baby...um, lady...one that I really want to...know... I, um, I got to let my feelings grow...show... (building, dancing a little) She's fresh! Exciting! She's so exciting to me! She's fresh! ex...cit...ing... He trails off as Paulette trudges by, pushing a handcart stacked with frozen burgers. She stops and glares at him. He meekly takes the handcart from her and exits. He passe by James.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Brennan. You want to pick up some more shifts?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 88. 117

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Good. ‘Cause Joel just quit.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James drives his mother’s car. He pulls over and parks in front of a smallish, drab-looking house. CUT TO -- James ringing the doorbell. After a moment, Joel comes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Whoa. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You didn’t call me back.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Well, um, okay... Look, I can’t abide the humiliation of having you see the inside of my house. The vile plastic slipcovers, the ‘art fair’ paintings... (shudders ) Meet me ‘round back. Joel shuts the door in James’s face. EXT. JOEL’S BACKYARD - MOMENTS LATER 119 Joel and James sit in lawn chairs in the small backyard. Joel lights his pipe. The oversized eyeglasses, the pipe his slumped posture all add up to give Joel the appearanc a weary old man trapped in a young man’s body.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Is it because of Sue? I mean, she doesn’t deserve you. You're a great guy-

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: James. I’m not good-looking. And I’m poor. With all these yuppies around, women aren’t gonna go near a poor guy.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: That’s ridiculous. Joel grunts. He turns away, chews on his pipe.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: I know you think you’re really deprived because you didn’t go to Europe this summer.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 89. 119 120

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JOEL (cont'd) But you went to a better school than me, you don’t have to pay rent to your parents, you’re going off to Columbia fucking University. So, Margaret Mead, you're stuck with us low-lifes for one summer, but you get to leave.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Joel, all I was trying to say was that not all women are shallow like that. Em isn’t like that.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Em! That’s...fuck... (emotions overcoming him) I don’t even know if you even appreciate what you have?! I mean, you’re chasing after Lisa P.?! When Em’s right there! This incredible, beautiful person is right fucking there! I mean, I can’t watch it...I can’t be around it anymore... Even this small release of feeling is excruciating to Joe

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: (quietly) That’s why I quit. I can’t be around you two anymore. I feel like a...hypocrite. Joel looks away. James finally gets it -- Joel’s in love with Em.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I...I had no idea.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Because you’re too...fucking...selfish. Fuck this. Fuck everything. Joel flings his pipe down on the ground, then walks to th house. The rickety screen door clatters behind him, leavi James alone in the yard. INT. “GAMES PALACE” ARCADE, ADVENTURELAND - DAY 120 Em works the arcade. She sees Sue O’Malley conferring wit FEMALE CO-WORKER, watching her. Sue exits and the co-work walks over to Em.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: Did you hear?

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Hear what?  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 90. 120 121 122

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: James went on a date with Lisa P.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: (defiantly) You heard me. Frigo saw them at some restaurant in Northport. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Yeah, right, I’m sure that happened. Em turns and walks away, her look changing to one of consternation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Em is lying on the couch, staring at the TV, which shows Run-DMC video “It’s Tricky”. From the other room, she can hear Francy, who speaks in a clipped, near-hysterical tone:

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ---I can’t take it! And you just let her run rampant! Coming in at all hours! Treating me with disrespect! Blatant disrespect... Em moves slowly toward the doorway to hear better.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ..-And when she’s here, she just lies around on the couch all day! You have to do something! You never do anything! I can’t take it any more...!

dialogues.speaker: MR. LEWIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, okay...Maybe...I...Maybe she needs to go see Dr. Schlagel again...

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She has to do something! Something has to change! Or else! INT. EM’S BEDROOM, LEWIN HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER 122 Em pulls open a dresser drawer. She removes a wig. Unlike Francy’s red fright wig, this one is straight and sandy blonde. Em stuffs it into her bag.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 91. 122 123 124

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WE PAN with Em as she exits, ending on a FRAMED PHOTO OF ATTRACTIVE WOMAN IN HER THIRTIES. She looks a bit like Em and has sandy-colored hair -- like the wig Em just left w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Em comes down the stairs. She can hear Francy still bitch about her:

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You know she works at that trashy park just to embarrass us. Do you have any idea what people think, Ike?

dialogues.speaker: IKE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Look, I tried to give her money to travel this summer... I can’t force her out of the house...

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Well, maybe you can.

dialogues.speaker: IKE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Francy...

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (loudly) Hey, I’m going out. Gonna meet James for a late movie...

dialogues.speaker: MR. LEWIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. Drive carefully, sweetheart. Em hurries out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James, on break, drinks a soda and watches the bumper car

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Brennan! James turns to see Frigo scampering across the midway wit Rich, who is clutching a bag of candy.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Brennan, you gotta hear this! (turns to Rich) Tell him what you told me!

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: I ate too many circus peanuts.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Not that, retard! The thing about Em.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 92. 124 125

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Frigo! Wait, what thing about Em?

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: I saw Em and Connell. In his car.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Yeah, and what did you tell me they were doin’?

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: (uneasy about the memory) I don’t know. Connell was doing push ups on Em. He didn’t have no pants.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: They were doin’ it!!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Shut up. When, Rich?

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: It was a while ago...like...a while ago.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: I bet she’s lubing up Connell’s boner right now.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Shut up, you idiot.

dialogues.speaker: RICH
dialogues.text: Here, James, I don’t want any more. He hands James his bag of circus peanuts.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Uh. Thanks, Rich. EXT. CONNELL’S HOUSE - LATER 125 Connell’s green Duster pulls into the driveway of Connell smallish house. He steps out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: EM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. Connell turns. He sees Em (in wig and sunglasses), sittin in her car, parked across the street.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: (whispering) What the fuck?! (hurrying toward her) Are you crazy?!  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07)

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: You know you can’t come here.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: But I wore a disguise.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Go home. Now.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Christ, now I have two wives! Go home!

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (bursting into tears) I can’t do this anymore! I can’t...I feel...I hate myself...fuck...

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: (suddenly in caretaker mode) Okay, okay. Look, my wife probably just heard me pull in. lLet’s talk somewhere. I’ll make an excuse. Park over by my mom’s house and wait. Okay? Em, staving off tears, nods. He hurries back toward his house as she starts her car and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lewin is in bed, going over some legal briefs, classi music playing low. The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LEWIN
dialogues.text: (answering phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT Mr. Lewin and James, who stands in a hallway, Fr hovering over him.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Lewin, it’s James. Is Emily there?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LEWIN
dialogues.text: Isn’t she with you? She said she was going out to meet you. 93.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07)

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Oh. I think we got our wires crossed... James hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: What’d he say? PUSH IN ON James, anxiety welling up in him.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Can you get your mother’s car? 128 INT. BASEMENT, CONNELL’S MOTHER’S HOUSE - NIGHT Em sits on the couch, her wig and sunglasses beside her. Connell starts to pour them two bourbons.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: I don’t want a drink. He shrugs and combines the drinks in one glass for himsel

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: You know James went out with Lisa P. last week.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: I heard. I can’t exactly judge him now, can I? Connell crosses to her and sits.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: You do know that it’s possible to be in love with two people at the same, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (pissed off) You think I think this is about love?

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: I don’t know what word you’d use. And I don’t really care. I just know how you make me feel.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? How do I make you feel?

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Alive. Beat 94. 127 128  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 95. 128 129 130 131

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (quietly) Give me a fucking break.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: I don’t want to give you up. But I will, if you tell me to. They look at each other for a long beat. He leans forward and kisses her. She surrenders to it, melting into his ar as they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: EXT. FRIGO’S HOUSE - LATER 129 James is hiding behind a bush. Frigo comes hurrying out o his house.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: I got the keys. Push me out... Frigo hops into the car. James grunts as he pushes the massive car toward the street ... EXT. STREETS NEAR CONNELL’S MOTHER’S HOUSE - LATER 130 Frigo and James are driving. The Cutlass passes by “Crazy Benny’s Liquor Store”.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Turn here. Frigo turns onto a street.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Slow down.

dialogues.speaker: THEY PASS BY A LINE OF CARS
dialogues.text: ending on Em’s Pacer. EXT. STREET BY CONNELL’S MOTHER’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER 1 The car is parked. James broods.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: I got an aluminum bat in the trunk if you want to smash in her windows?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Let’s just wait.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 96. 132 EXT. STREET BY CONNELL’S MOTHER’S HOUSE - LATER 132 WIDE ON the street. We hear a fence gate opening and shutting. From beside the house, Em emerges from the darkness. She crosses to her car.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. Em turns around. James is in the street. He looks stricke

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: James? What are you doing here? Beat. An unbearable silence.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Are you...? Connell? She looks away.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (quietly) It started back in June. Before you and I even met. How did you find me here?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Frigo heard that Connell used to take some other girl here. To his mother’s basement. Another blow to Em.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (incredulous) I just don’t understand how...why you would...I just don’t understand...

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (pained, pitiful) I...I came here to... Em stops herself. She feels she is beyond redemption.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (bitterly angry) You just think I’m some fucking pussy, someone to kill time with, while you were waiting for Connell.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: I...no...look, I was...you deserve better than me, okay? Just don’t tell anyone, okay? Please don’t tell anyone...for Connell’s sake...  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 97. 132 133 134

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You're worried about Connell? You think he’s worried about you?! (heartbroken) I would’ve...I... James is being devoured by the hurt. He turns and walks quickly to the Cutlass. He gets in. Frigo revs the engine and peels out.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (pitifully) James... He gets in the car. Frigo revs the engine and peels out.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: (honking as he passes Em) You’re a whore! Em runs to her car, gets in. As she drives away, she sees Connell watching her from a bay window in his mother’s ho INT. JAMES’S BEDROOM, BRENNAN HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 133 James is going through a box of his college notebooks and papers. On his clock radio, WE HEAR a concerned CALLER to talk show:

dialogues.speaker: RADIO CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: --.-I mean, think of how the country reacted to Watergate. The outrage...there just isn’t the same level with Iran-Contra... He stops at one. CLOSE ON the title: The Birth of Romanticism in Shakespeare’s “Winter’s Tale” (and the Tragicomedies) James tosses the paper into a garbage bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James's father sits in the living room, reading the paper sipping a cocktail.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO CALLER, (V.O., CONTINUED)
dialogues.text: .--which is arguably, y'know, a bigger betrayal. Is there a shift in the country? Are we becoming more cynical? Are we becoming cold-hearted? Out the bay window, we see James lugging an overstuffed garbage bag to the curb. He drops it into a garbage can.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 98. 135 136

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is punching in with other employees. As he exits, h hears:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (whispering 0.C.) James! James turns. Connell hides behind a stack of soda crates.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: I have to talk to you. Connell exits out a back door. James follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connell and James enter the lot. Connell looks agitated.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: I talked to Em. I know you know... (beat) Look, I can’t expect you to be happy about any of this. But will you hear me out? James shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: You’re a smart guy. You know that it’s possible to love two people at the same time, right? (beat) I love my wife. I really do. I don’t want to hurt her. I fucking despise the idea of her getting hurt. And I don’t think she has to. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I won’t tell anyone.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What about Frigo?

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: He won’t tell anyone. I gave him fifty bucks. Are we cool?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 99. 136 137

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Connell nods and hurries off. WIDE ON James alone in the lot.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: EXT. “LAUGHING CLOWN” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - NIGHT 137 “One Night In Bangkok” by Murray Head is playing. It’s a sweltering August night. A BALLOON POPS. The winning customer, a WEALTHY PREPSTER, throws his arms in the air, surrounded by his buddies and their pretty girlfriends.

dialogues.speaker: WEALTHY PREPSTER
dialogues.text: I won! Yeah! I am the champion! To the victor go the spoils! James rolls his eyes, then gives the guy his prize -- a worthless little banana-shaped plush toy with two black d glued on for eyes. He wipes the sweat off his brow.

dialogues.speaker: WEALTHY PREPSTER
dialogues.text: What? This piece of crap is first prize? What is this? Is it a banana?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (not in the mood) It’s a banana with eyes.

dialogues.speaker: WEALTHY PREPSTER
dialogues.text: Fuck that. Give me the bulldog.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You have to win five times for the prizes in that row. PREPSTER’S GIRLFRIEND (mocking him) You have to win five times for the prizes in that row.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Good one. You really got me.

dialogues.speaker: WEALTHY PREPSTER
dialogues.text: (staring James down) Hey. I’d watch my mouth if I were you, carnival boy. The prepster throws the banana at James and walks away, h friends chortling as they follow. CLOSE ON James seething, wanting to fight back. But he doesn’t.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is traversing the midway. THE LOUD, BAD POP MUSIC, SQUEALING YOUNGSTERS, THE CRUSHING HEAT -- it’s all deepl irritating to him. As James approaches the “Hats Off To Larry” booth, he see is working there. He changes directions. 139 INT. “GAMES PALACE” ARCADE, ADVENTURELAND - MOMENTS L James passes by the race car video game -- Lisa P. sits i the cockpit. He leans in.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hey. LISA P. What’s up? James pauses, trying to manufacture some confidence.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Wanna hang out tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James and Lisa P. walk on the beach. James stops and look wistfully at the lifeguard stand where he and Em had been few weeks prior. He then turns to Lisa P., holding up a crooked joint.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: This is my last one. I found it at the bottom of my wallet. LISA P. Mint. Lisa takes it and lights up. LISA P. Hey, so, hey...so what did happen with you and Em?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (unsure) I can’t... I made a promise I wouldn’t talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 141 EXT. PATIO, “THE RIPTIDE” - NIGHT 141 Away from the raucous frat boy types, James and Lisa P. a sharing a chaise. They’re high and drunk.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 101. 141 142 143

dialogues.speaker: LISA P.
dialogues.text: (in an astonished whisper) No way! Em was sleeping with Connell? Like, doing it?!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (nodding) Can you believe it? LISA P. Whoa. I mean... Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (condescendingly) You know...I just feel sorry for them. I mean, having to sneak around, lie to everyone. It’s pathetic. LISA P. It’s, like, so pathetic! He’s a married man...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You can’t tell anyone. Ever. LISA P. Of course. I would never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Em is arriving for her shift. As Em passes a game booth, few employees whisper something to each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Em is making change for kids. Munch strolls over.

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: Hey, Em, what’s up?

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Just loving life.

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: You know, I, uh, play drums.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Oh. I didn’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: I did this really killer drum solo at the senior talent show once. I did ‘Limelight’ by Rush? I sang, too! He air-drums as he sings in an unpleasant falsetto:  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 102. 143 144 145 146

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: Living on a lighted stage, approaches the unreal, for those who think and feel... In touch with some reality, beyond the gilded cage! Bidalah-bum, bidalah-bum- bum, tikka-tikka-POW-POW! (etc.)... He finally stops and grins at her. Em stares at him, agha

dialogues.speaker: MUNCH
dialogues.text: You like musicians, right? (leaning close) Don’t put on an act. Everyone knows about you and Connell. A look of true horror comes over Em. She pushes by him.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Get the fuck away from me! She runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is doing some paperwork. Em enters, looking pale an miserable.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Em. What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James rides with his mother. As they pull into the parkin lot, he sees Em’s car speeding out of the lot. Her tires screech as she whips onto the street... INT. MANAGER’S OFFICE, ADVENTURELAND - DAY 146 James enters the office as Paulette and Bobby are mid- conversation:

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: (disbelieving) She didn’t give a reason?!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No. The summer’s almost over, what would make her quit now?

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: It was probably your dancing. She crosses to the shift board. James punches in, lingeri

dialogues.speaker: PAULETTE
dialogues.text: They’re dropping like flies...  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 103. 146 147 148

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Paulette crossing out every box WITH EM’S NAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is walking past the carousel.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Brennan! James turns to see Connell bearing down on him.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: What did you tell Lisa P.?!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Connell, look, I...

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: What did you tell Lisa P.? Did you tell her everything?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (beat) I think so.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: You think so?! This is my life, James! You’re just fucking around for a summer!! Ronnie’s coming to the park tonight!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I’m...I’m sorry. Connell rubs his forehead. He look up at James, his eyes filled with worry -- and fear.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: I don’t know...if she...I don’t know what I would... Connell, at a complete loss, walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James approaches Lisa P., who’s taking tickets. Kelly is on the ride platform, locking people into their seats.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (distressed) Lisa, I don’t know what to say... But everyone's talking about Em and Connell. LISA P. Kelly has such a big f-ing mouth. (softer, contritely) I’m sorry ‘cause I gave you my word.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 104.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LISA P. (cont'd) We were so wasted that night. I can’t hide nothing from Kell. She moves closer to James, puts on a kittenish look. LISA P. Are you mad at me?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It’s just...Connell’s freaked out...Em quit... LISA P. I feel bad about Connell. I have a hard time feeling sorry for Em. James gives her a quizzical look. LISA P. Guys can’t help themselves.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: But he’s the married one. LISA P. Yeah! Em’s a friggin’ homewrecker! James is amazed at this attitude.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: But he was cheating on his wife. LISA P. I can’t believe you're defending her!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Cause, what? Guys can be shitty, but women can’t? LISA P. ("you're a freak” look) Whoa. Lisa P. shakes her head as she turns and walks over to Ke who’s been watching from the ride controls.

dialogues.speaker: A NEW SONG COMES OVER THE LOUDSPEAKERS
dialogues.text: “Rock Me Amadeus” (of course). Lisa P. and Kelly squeal a begin to dance together.

dialogues.speaker: LISA P.
dialogues.text: (singing along) Amadeus, Amadeus...AMADEUS! Amadeus, Amadeus...AMADEUS! Oh oh oh, Amadeus!!!  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 105. 148 149 150 151

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: James watches them for a beat. He turns and walks away. EXT. “SHOOT OUT THE STAR” GAME - THAT NIGHT 149 As James collects tickets from some kids, he notices a co walking up the midway. It’s Connell and his wife. Ronnie carries their son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She’s animated and upbeat, doing all the talking. As she focuses on the baby, Connell and James make momentary eye contact. We see how he’s trying to hide his anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: RONNIE
dialogues.text: Take Mikey. I gotta pee. Ronnie hands Connell the baby, then kisses him. As she exits, he breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie enters a stall and closes the door. She sits down the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: EM LEWIN FUCKED CONELL
dialogues.text: Underneath, someone else has written

dialogues.speaker: FUCKIN SLUT
dialogues.text: Ronnie stares at the graffiti. She knows it must be true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they eat dinner, James’s parents watch a small black a white TV news report on the continuing Iran-Contra hearin

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hey, dad, can I borrow the car tonight? Going to see a movie with Joel.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: (looking at tv) Sure. Do you think he knew they were doing all that? Reagan is on the TV screen.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: They should leave Ronnie alone. As if his job isn’t hard enough.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 106. 152 153 154 155 156

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James drives. On the radio -- some rock deejay’s moronic patter. James snaps it off. EXT. DANNY’S BAR - NIGHT 153 James pulls into the parking lot. The sign reads:

dialogues.speaker: BOYS IN TH ATTIC
dialogues.text: INT. DANNY’S BAR - NIGHT 154 James drops quarters into the jukebox and chooses a song. Neil Young’s feedback-heavy “Hey, Hey, My, My (Into The Black)” starts to play. James sits at the bar and knocks back the last gulp of a bourbon-on-the-rocks.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (motioning to the bartender) Another, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Em’s Pacer is pulled off the road. Em stares out at the water, zombie-like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Em enters the house. As she passes the living room, a few extra faces turn toward her. Her dad and Francy are entertaining two other couples.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY
dialogues.text: Emily. You know the Waldsteins and the Ostrows. Em nods slightly. She walks over to the sideboard and pou herself a Scotch. Francy gives Mr. Lewin an incensed look

dialogues.speaker: MRS. OSTROW
dialogues.text: (to fill the awkward moment) Oh, Francy, I love the new pieces. The lamps! And that wonderful sideboard in the foyer!

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you noticed!

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Oh, really? I thought the house was a lot nicer the way my mom used to have it.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 107.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: EM (cont'd) This? (indicating the decor) Pretty barfarific, if you ask me. Stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LEWIN
dialogues.text: Emily, you can’t say things like that.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (trembling) That’s right. I can’t say what I’m thinking and feeling every fucking day! Tears rushing to her eyes, she hurries out. 157 INT. KITCHEN, LEWIN HOUSE/CONNELL’S HOUSE - CONTINUOU Em enters, an irate Francy dogging her steps. Em turns around.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Do yourself a favor and leave me alone. Francy halts, tongue-tied. Em sips her Scotch.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: You have no domain over me.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY
dialogues.text: (exploding) Who the fuck do you think you are?! You think you can talk to me like that?! Ike!...It’s...Ike! Gimme that- NEIL YOUNG’S “HEY, HEY, MY, MY” FADES BACK IN, underscori Francy and Em scuffling. Francy grabs Em’s drink.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY
dialogues.text: No-No-No!! You will do what I- Em suddenly reaches up and yanks on Francy’s wig. Francy shrieks. Em makes a getaway with the wig in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Em sprints up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (losing it)

dialogues.speaker: AAAAAGH
dialogues.text: 159 INT. EM’S BEDROOM, LEWIN HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 159 Em enters and locks the door.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 108. 159 160 161

dialogues.speaker: MR. LEWIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Em. Open that door! Em pauses for a split second...

dialogues.speaker: MR. LEWIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Em, I’m not kidding. This is .-.-I’m going to kill you, y unacceptable! Em, open the LITTLE FUCKING BITCH!!! door! Em tosses the wig out her open window. It sails into the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Neil Young song continues over the action as James stumbles out of the bar and toward his dad’s car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James's father’s Reliant comes over a hill. It’s raining hard. As he winds through suburban neighborhoods, James reaches under the seat and pulls out his father’s hidden Cutty Sa bottle. He gulps from it. Tears sting his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: speeds up. RATTLES LOUDLY over some bumps.

dialogues.speaker: THE GLOWING RAINDROPS
dialogues.text: fly toward the headlights.

dialogues.speaker: SHRIEK AS HE WRENCHES THEM FROM THE COILED STRINGS...
dialogues.text: James takes a corner too fast. The car begins to skid. He slams on the brakes and the car goes into a spin. It careens onto a lawn, clumps of dirt and grass flying i its wake. The car bumpily slides to a halt. No sound but rain thudd on the car roof. It takes James a moment to ascertain that he hasn’t hit anything, that he’s okay. He laughs bitterly. He slowly drives off the lawn. He rolls past a few houses and pulls into his driveway.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 109. 162 163

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’re looking up at Mrs. Brennan, who’s rapping on a wind

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Rise and shine. REVERSE ON James, jolted awake. He has passed out in the front seat of the car. It’s morning.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Get out of the car. James opens the car door. He vomits on the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Jesus. James steps out of the car, looking miserable.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Come here. Mrs. Brennan leads James around to the other side of the He is surprised to see Mrs. Frigo standing there, a scowl her face. Mrs. Brennan points down -- there are large scrapes from the bumper to door. AND A SIZEABLE SHRUB IS JAMMED INTO THE CAR’S WHEEL WELL.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Care to explain how Mrs. Frigo’s hydrangea got here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James sits at the kitchen table across from his parents.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: So explain this, mister? Mrs. Brennan puts the bottle of Cutty Sark on the table. James looks at his father.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: That’s...not...mine.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Ha! Don’t give me that! Mr. Brennan is frozen. James sighs -- he’s not going to l the cat out of the bag.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 110. 163 164

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MRS. BRENNAN (CONT’D) What is wrong with you?! The drinking, that cigarette you claim wasn’t Marijuana. You’re acting like a juvenile delinquent. I think it’s that Adventureland. You’re quitting that job.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (quietly) I never want to go there again.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: How much have you saved up?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: One thousand, three hundred and twenty- two dollars. Give or take.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Well, that might cover the damage. You’re paying for Gloria’s shrub, too.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: But...that’s my rent money. For New York City. Like, three months rent and the security deposit.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Not anymore. James looks inconsolable. His father sees an escape openi

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: I better check on those sprinklers! He hurries out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another stifling, humid day. James is mowing the lawn, drenched with sweat, looking more despondent than ever. Mr. Brennan comes to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: James! You have a call! James turns off the lawn mower

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: It’s that girl. Emily. As James enters, Mr. Brennan gives him a sheepish look.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 111. 165 166 167

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Brennan looks up from her library book as James ente He crosses to the phone receiver, which lies on a counter He stares at it, deliberating. James takes the receiver and hangs it up.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Good. She’s a troubled young lady. James looks at her quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Mrs. Frigo told me about her and the Married man. You don’t need a girl like that in your life. James takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James rides the train, listening to his Walkman. He wears oxford shirt, pressed black pants and dress shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As James enters the Ivy League alumni club, Eric jumps up from an armchair. His hair is shorter, he wears a finely tailored suit.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: (hugging James) James! Sit, sit.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: How the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: (to waiter) Two Glenlivets, neat, please. (to James) I’m fine. Thoroughly fine. So you have a job interview?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It’s a training session, really. I'd work on a trial basis. Legal proofreading.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: (doesn’t give a shit) Huh.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 112.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Tell me about Europe.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: This trip changed me, Brennan.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Really? The waiter arrives with their Scotches. Eric takes a sip his, pausing dramatically.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: It was revelatory. There I was, going from one incredible city to the next...the ruins, the cathedrals, the endless procession of art treasures...And I realized something. (beat) Screw the old world. I want the new world. And I want it now. Right now.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What? What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: I saw myself, five, six years from now, still dicking around, trying to ‘find myself’. But these are the years we can’t waste, Brennan. We’re young, we’re vital. Now’s my moment and I’m taking it.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yes. Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: I’m going to Harvard Business.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You, what...? You’re applying?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: I’m in. Strings were pulled, wheels greased, destiny’s been set in motion.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I’m...I’m surprised.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: James, forget about the naive, utopian crap we used to talk about. The world has changed. It’s winner-take-all. The great minds, the great artists of our time are the entrepreneurs. Society's their canvas.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 113. 167 168

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ERIC (cont'd) (leaning closer) You’re a smart guy, Brennan. If you remain passive, just bumble along like you always do, you'll be on the sidelines. You’1ll just be commenting on the people who are doing. Eric fixes a serious look on James for a beat -- then sit back and sips his Scotch. James is dumbstruck.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: So, did you finally get laid this summer or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS rows of cubicles, where people are hunched ove documents and computers. WE END ON a cubicle where James sits with a late 20s, out-of-shape, TIRED-LOOKING GUY. He showing James some legal documents.

dialogues.speaker: TIRED-LOOKING GUY
dialogues.text: If you have half a brain, the job’s easy. Unbearably, soul-crushingly dull. But easy.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: How’s the night shift? I’1l have classes during the day.

dialogues.speaker: TIRED-LOOKING GUY
dialogues.text: The night shift is fucking awful. It’s a fucking stake through your brain. But after one a.m. pays double-time.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Double-time?

dialogues.speaker: TIRED-LOOKING GUY
dialogues.text: Why else would I do it? Okay... (sorting some papers) Fuck...It’s amazing how many of these fucking Ivy League grads can’t write a single coherent sentence. I read this stuff -- it’s like what a lunatic might write on an asylum wall with his turd. James laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TIRED-LOOKING GUY
dialogues.text: You sure you want this job?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Fuck it. Sure.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 114.

dialogues.speaker: TIRED-LOOKING GUY
dialogues.text: Okay. Fuck it. Let’s get started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Brennan drives James home, swing music on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Overnight shift?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It pays double-time.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Your mother’s not going to like that. Beat. James turns to his father.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Do you have a problem with it?

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: (non-committal) Me? I...I might. I don’t...we’ll talk about it at home. His father turns up the radio. James turns the radio down

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I’m taking the job, dad. I’ve made my decision.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: But your mother...

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: She’1l live. James's father looks over at his son, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRENNAN
dialogues.text: (warmly ) Okay, kiddo.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I need to stop by the park. I have to get my last paycheck. James turns the music back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junior’s “Mama Used To Say” plays as James walks through park, avoiding eye contact with anyone. As he turns a corner, he overhears a familiar voice:  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 115. 170

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -.-it was a little club. In Manhattan, in the Village... James comes around a game booth to find Connell standing front of a kiddie ride. He has the rapt attention of thre young women, 18-19 years old.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: ...The shows were always wild, people partied like crazy, we’d jam ‘til five in the morning. So, one of these nights, halfway through our last set, I’m noticing that everyone in the place keeps turning around, looking at this guy who just came in. He’s standing in the back with a couple of buddies. Then I realize it’s fucking Neil Young.

dialogues.speaker: PRETTIEST GIRL
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: I knew he was playing the Garden the next night. So Neil gives me a little friendly musician nod. We finish our song and some guy from their group comes up to me and asks, is it okay if Neil sits in for a few?

dialogues.speaker: PRETTIEST GIRL
dialogues.text: (all she can say) ---Holy shit! Holy shit!...

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: So Neil comes up on the stage. We shake hands. Just say hello and shit. Puts on a guitar. And we did a whole fucking set of his songs. We did ‘Southern Man’...‘Cinnamon Girl’...’‘My My, Hey Hey’... ‘Corvette Killer’...‘Like a Hurricane’...

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) --.-Oh my God!...What a pisser!...Holy shit!... Connell grins. Then he notices James standing nearby.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL, (TO JAMES)
dialogues.text: Hey, I want to talk to you. (to the girls) Ladies, hold on a sec. Connell crosses to James. He lowers his voice.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 116.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: You're fucking lucky. The whole thing’s blown over. Ronnie’s calmed down. Mostly.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Well. I’m glad... How’s Em? Do you know if she’s okay?

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: Em? She’s young and pretty, she comes from money. I think she’1l be okay. Beat. James gets an agitated look.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It’s Cortez the Killer.

dialogues.speaker: CONNELL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: It’s not ‘Corvette Killer’. The Neil Young song is ‘Cortez the Killer’. Cortez. He was a Spanish conqueror. Overthrew the Aztecs. Connell looks tongue-tied. James turns and walks away, passing by Bobby, who is singing along with the music:

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (mangling the lyrics) Mama used to say, take your tie off, man! Mama used to say, don’t you brush to get gold! Mama used to say- (sees James) Hey, Brennan!

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hi, Bobby. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Ah, you know, it’s Labor Day weekend. The season’s almost over... (really getting wistful) I always get kinda sad, y’know? I guess there's always gonna be that part of me that thinks of summer as this magical time, you know what I mean? Anyway, you're a good kid, Brennan. I hope it all works- a fair amount vomit comes pouring down on Bobby.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 117. 170 171

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You’ve got to be shitting me. Bobby looks up at the “Sky Chopper” gondolas overhead.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Which one of you little shits...! (hurries off) This fucking place! What kind of fucking life is this...fuck...mother...goddamn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Brennan's car rolls up to a traffic light and stops. James is looking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CORNER
dialogues.text: a rusty old Dodge Dart has just pulled over. And Joel is getting out of it, looking furtive, not wanting to be associated with his father and his battered car.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (to Mr. Brennan) Um. Wait for me at the corner. James hops out of the car. The Dart sputters away as Joel starts walking.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (jogging across the street) Hey! Joel! Joel turns around. He’s wearing his “games” shirt.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You're back.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Yeah. Cash flow problems. (beat) I heard about all the shit that went down. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Fucked up my dad’s car. Lost every cent I made this summer.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Well. We're both losers then. I better go, I’m late...  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 118. 171 172 173

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Okay. (starts away then turns back) Hey. You should come to the city. To hang out.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: I’m serious. If you don’t come, I’1l come out here and drag you out of this place. Joel smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JOEL
dialogues.text: Hopefully won’t come to that. I'’11 call you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Sounds good. Joel nods, then heads down the sidewalk, toward the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James stands in his backyard, taking in the evening.

dialogues.speaker: A PIERCING WHISTLE
dialogues.text: echoes from a field behind his house. James sees a few bottle rockets shoot into the sky. He climbs over the fen and heads toward the group of young men shooting the fireworks. Frigo runs toward James:

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Brennan! We stole a case of Schlitz from Zeblisky’s garage!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frigo runs around with a roman candle, pointing it like a rifle, as it shoots fireballs.

dialogues.speaker: AN EMPTY SCHLITZ CAN
dialogues.text: is tossed into a pile of cans. James, sitting under a tre opens another beer. He lies on the ground, staring up. He watches an errant bottle rocket ricochet into the branches above his head. WE MOVE IN CLOSE ON his pensive face. JAMES’S MEMORY. THERE IS NO SOUND.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 119.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WE’RE WATCHING EM, from James’s P.O.V., as she rides the roller coaster at Adventureland. She’s feigning boredom a the ride swoops and dips recklessly behind her.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER IMAGES OF EM
dialogues.text: - At Danny’s Bar, giving the camera a devilish look as sh throws back a shot of bourbon - A moment at a game booth, where Em turns away from an irritating customer and shoots us a “save me from this hell” look - Looking at James, sitting on the hood of her car, at th beach at night, her eyes filled with sadness and fear - Driving in her car, at dusk, singing along with the rad - In her pool, at night, staring at us JAMES’S DAYDREAMING is broken by Frigo, who stands over him:

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Don’t fall asleep, Brennan.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Cause I’ll jack off on your face. Frigo giggles like a lunatic.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: What on earth is wrong with you? James stands up. He’s come to a decision:

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Look, can you get your mom’s car again? Right now? I’11l give you twenty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Thirty.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Forty. James shakes his head. He gets out his wallet, removes tw twenties and hands them over.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 120. 173 174 175

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Frigo goes to pocket the cash, James slugs him in the privates. Frigo collapses onto the grass.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (as he walks off) Even. EXT. FRIGO’S HOUSE - NIGHT 174 Once again, Frigo is behind the wheel of his mother’s Cut as James pushes the car out of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cutlass rumbles down a street. As they approach Em's house, they see that there are a few cars in the driveway several more parked on the street.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Huh. Frigo stops the car.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: I’1l wait for you.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: No, don’t. Beat. Frigo looks sympathetically at James.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: Hope it works out.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: (surprised & a little touched) Thanks, Frigo. James, surprised and a little touched by Frigo, gets out the car and crosses toward the front door. He rings the bell. He turns back toward Frigo. He’s not in the car -- instead, he’s over on the side of Em’s lawn, urinating on tree.

dialogues.speaker: FRIGO
dialogues.text: I can’t hold it! James hears the door open and turns back. Em stands there Behind her we can hear an adult cocktail party in progres Em stares at James, tongue-tied.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Hey, I wanted to talk to you. My timing sucks as usual.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 121. 175 176 177

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Um. Come in. Hurry. She ushers him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Em leads James past the living room, where oblivious adul are clustered, talking loudly. They hurry up the stairs. INT. EM’S BEDROOM, LEWIN HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 177 James enters the room. Em follows, shutting the door. The look at each other for an awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: This is pretty weird.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) Look. I’m here to apologize. First of all, I’m sorry I hung up on you that day. Worse, it’s my fault everyone found out about you and Connell. I told Lisa P. And...while you and I were seeing each other...I went on a date with Lisa P. Nothing really happened. We kissed a little. But I...I don’t know...I feel bad about that.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: I heard you guys went out.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: You did? You never said anything.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: (looking down) What could I say? (beat) I’m sorry if I hurt you. I...I don’t know what’s wrong with me. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: The only thing wrong is that you need to find someone you can trust. She looks up at him for a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: EM
dialogues.text: Are you nominating yourself?  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 122. 177 178

dialogues.speaker: JAMES
dialogues.text: As long as you don’t mind trusting a guy who clearly doesn’t have a fucking clue about anything. Em moves to James. She pulls his shirt off. He leans forward and kisses her. Without abandoning her lips, he slides off her t-shirt. They kick off their shoes, pull o socks, then help each other out of their pants. Em takes her bra. They both slide off their underwear. They stand facing each other, naked. Their eyes are nervo and searching. James caresses her cheek and smiles. Em laughs, blinking away a few tears. We hold on them for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s right after sunup. Nobody is here yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The empty midway; a rusty cotton candy vending cart; the snack bar menu sign that hasn’t changed for years and is missing letters; the dark and silent video arcade; the “B the Clown” machine, with an “OUT OF ORDER” sign; the moronically grinning “Hats Off To Larry” mannequin; racks stuffed “bananas with eyes”; empty Chopper ride gondolas, creaking and swaying... WE END ON A SHOT THAT CRANES INTO THE AIR, showing a wide view of the shabby little park. A desolate wind blows through Adventureland. Another summer's almost over. END CREDITS OVER “Ever Fallen In Love” by The Buzzcocks.
